Scheme_Name: Atma Nirbhar Matsya Palan Yojana
Details: The "Atma Nirbhar Matsya Palan Yojana (ANMPY)" was launched by the Department of Fisheries, Government of Arunachal Pradesh. It aims to promote self-reliant fish farming practices and enhance income generation among Scheduled Tribe (ST) beneficiaries through aquaculture activities. Under this flagship scheme, a credit-linked front-ended subsidy is provided for fisheries development to individual farmers, Self Help Groups (SHGs), and Farmers Producer Organizations (FPOs) in Arunachal Pradesh. Scheme ImplementationThe scheme is implemented by the District Fisheries Development Officers (DFDOs), under the supervision of District Level Screening Committees (DLSCs).
Benefits: Benefits:45% Government Subsidy.45% Bank Loan (credit-linked).10% Beneficiary Contribution.
Eligibility: Eligibility Criteria for Individual FarmersThe applicant must be a Scheduled Tribe (ST) of Arunachal Pradesh.The applicant must be a permanent resident of Arunachal Pradesh. The applicant must be between 18 to 60 years of age.The applicant must not be a bank defaulter.The applicant must not be a government servant.The applicant must have experience in fisheries or aquaculture.The applicant must have sufficient and suitable land for aquaculture activity.Eligibility Criteria for Self-Help Groups (SHGs)SHGs must be affiliated with APRSLM (Arunachal Pradesh State Rural Livelihood Mission).SHGs under NERCOMP (for Changlang) are also eligible.SHGs must be actively engaged in fisheries or aquaculture.Eligibility Criteria for Farmers Producer Organizations (FPOs)The FPO must be registered.The FPO must have at least 100 shareholders.The FPO must have at least one audited balance sheet.Only FPOs engaged in fisheries/aquaculture are eligible.
Application_Process: OnlineOfflineInterested and eligible students need to apply online on the Atma Nirbhar Yojana portal. New User RegistrationSelect the "Login" option.Subsequently, click on the "Register Here" link.Complete the registration form with the requisite details, including your name, Aadhaar card number, email ID, and mobile number.Establish a password for your account.Upon successful registration, the applicant will receive a User ID and password.Login & Application Process:Log in using the provided User ID and password to access the application form.Fill in the complete application form.Upload the required documents, including a photograph, caste certificate, residential certificate, and land ownership proof, etc.Submit the application form.
Documents_Required: Passport-size PhotographAadhaar CardPAN CardST CertificateDomicile Certificate/Permanent Resident Certificate (PRC)Proof of Land Holding (LPC/Certificate from Administrative Officer) (Annexure-I Enclosed)Photocopy of 1st page of Bank Passbook No Objection Certificate (NOC) from Agri/Allied DepartmentAny Other Document if Required

Scheme_Name: Pandit Dindayal Upadhyay Awas Yojana-Developing Caste Welfare
Details: The "Pandit Dindayal Upadhyay Awas Yojana-Developing Caste Welfare"  is a welfare scheme by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department of Gujarat. The scheme aims to provide financial aid of up to Rs1,20,000/- to eligible beneficiaries from the socially and educationally backward classes (SEBC), economically backward classes (EBC), and nomadic exempted castes (NEC) for constructing new houses. The scheme prioritizes Below Poverty Line (BPL) households, most backward classes, and nomadic communities.
Benefits: Financial Assistance: Up to Rs1,20,000/- for house construction.
Eligibility: The applicant must belong to the Socially and Educationally Backward Class (SEBC)/ Economically Backward Class (EBC) or Nomadic Exempted Caste.The applicant must be a permanent resident of Gujarat.The applicant must have a total annual family income not exceeding Rs6,00,000/-.The applicant must have legal ownership of land or a valid allotment order for the construction of a house.
Application_Process: OnlineRegistration Process:Step 1: Go to the  eSamajKalyan portal and navigate to the "Pandit Dindayal Upadhyay Awas Yojana-Developing Caste Welfare" section under the menu option.Step 2: Click on Apply Now.Step 3: Click on "New User? Please Register Here".Step 4: Enter the required details and click Register.Application Process:Step 1: Enter your User ID, Password, and Captcha Code, then click "Login".Step 2: Read the scheme details carefully and click OK.Step 3: If your permanent address is correct, confirm it. Otherwise, enter your correct address.Step 4: Click Save & Next to proceed. Upload the relevant documents.Step 5: If you need to make changes, click "No, Cancel". If all details are correct, click "Yes, Submit".Step 6: Click Save Application. Note down your Application Number for future reference. You can also take a printout by clicking Print Application.Check Application Status: Click here.
Documents_Required: Aadhaar Card.Bank Passbook/Cancelled Cheque.Caste Certificate.Income Certificate.Land Ownership Aadhaar.Land Ownership Acknowledgment Form.Title Deed/Sanad Deed (as applicable).Map of land signed by Talati-cum-Mantri.Allotment order of land/house (if received under a poverty scheme).Permission letter for building construction.Certificate from the Circle Inspector for housing assistance.Certificate from City or Gram Panchayat Talati-cum-Mantri.

Scheme_Name: Old Age Pension for the Construction Workers (On Completion Of 65 Years) (UKBOCWWB)
Details: "Old Age Pension for the Construction Workers (On Completion Of 65 Years)'' is a social security scheme implemented by the Uttarakhand Bhavan and other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Government of Uttarakhand. Under this scheme, a monthly pension of Rs1,500/- per month to the eligible workers of the board who have completed 65 years of age. In case of death of the pensioner, the family pension to the surviving spouse is Rs500/- per month.
Benefits: An amount Rs1,500/- (Monthly).In case of death of the pensioner, the family pension to the surviving spouse is Rs500/- per month.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a resident of Uttarakhand.The applicant should have completed 65 years of age.The applicant should be registered under the Uttarakhand Bhavan and other Construction Workers Welfare Board.
Application_Process: Online - via CSCsFor New Registration under the UKBOCWWB:Step 1: To become a beneficiary, a construction worker who has completed 18 years of age and has not completed 60 years, has worked as a construction worker for at least 90 days during the preceding 1 year, can register himself/herself.Step 2: The eligible worker may visit the nearest Jan Seva Kendra or Shramik Suvidha Kendra along with all the relevant documents for online registration.Step 3: Upon successful registration, the applicant will receive a Registration Number for future reference.Step 4: The applicant can also track the status of their application online by visiting the official website: https://ukbocw.uk.gov.in/DynamicPages/LabourSearch-hi.aspxNote 1: After verification of the application, the photo identity card will be issued by the registration officer.Note 2: Registration will be done free of cost, which will be valid for three years and after the completion of three years, only Rs100/- contribution will be required to be deposited by the construction worker for every next three years.Application Process for Welfare Scheme Benefits:Step 1: To avail the benefits of the scheme, the eligible applicant may visit the nearest Shram Suvidha Kendra along with all the relevant documents.Step 2: Upon successful submission of the application form, the applicant will receive an Application Number for future reference.Step 3: The applicant can also track the status of their application online by visiting the official website: https://ukbocw.uk.gov.in/DynamicPages/LabourSchemeSearch.aspx
Documents_Required: For New/Renewal Labour Card:Passport Photocopies (2)Birth Proof (10th Certificate/Birth Certificate/Certificate from a Medical Officer/Notary Certified Self Declaration of the construction worker/Voter ID/Ration Card/Certificate issued by the Panchayat Officer, Gram Pradhan or counsellor.A certificate of employment as a construction worker for at least 90 days in the previous year.A nomination form by the construction worker for the nomination of his legal heirs.Aadhaar card,Ration card,Bank account with Aadhaar linked/seeded,Self-certification/self-declaration form (which can be obtained at Jan Suvidha Kendra or Shramik Suvidha Kendra only)Dependent's Aadhaar card.For Scheme Application:Letter of Application,Labour Card,Bank account details of the worker,Self-declaration certificate,Handwritten certificate stating that they have not received any assistance or in this regard, no application has been made in any other department.Note: It will be mandatory for the construction worker to submit a certificate of his/her being alive every six months which is verified by a gazetted officer.
Search_Keywords: Old Age Pension for the Construction Workers (On Completion Of 65 Years) (UKBOCWWB), oapcwcsf, Construction Workers, Labour, Old Age Pension, Senior Citizen, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Pension Scheme for Artisans
Details: The "Pension Scheme for Artisans" was launched by the Department of Industries, Government of Uttarakhand. It aims to provide financial security and dignity to senior traditional artisans aged 60 years and above. Under this scheme, artisans who are already receiving an old-age pension and belong to a family living below the poverty line are granted an additional incentive of Rs400/- per month.ObjectiveThe scheme supports artisans involved in traditional crafts like stone, wood, iron, bamboo, ringaal, natural fibres, etc., particularly those from below-poverty-line (BPL) families.
Benefits: The monthly incentive of Rs400 is provided to senior artisans who are already receiving old-age pension. Note:Payment is made quarterly (every 3 months) via the bank account or post office account of the beneficiary.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a resident of Uttarakhand.The applicant should be an artisan.The applicant should be engaged in traditional profession crafts like stone, wood, iron, bamboo, papermaking, ringaal, natural fibre crafts, etc.The applicant's age should be 60 years or above. The applicant is already receiving an old-age pension from the government.The applicant should belong to a BPL (Below Poverty Line) family.If the artisan's son or grandson is aged 20 years or more and the family still lives below the poverty line, the applicant remains eligible.The applicant should be approved as an artisan under criteria set by the state government from time to time.
Application_Process: OfflineApplication Process:Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the General Manager, District Industries Centre and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.ORThe interested applicant downloads the application form from the official website. Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required).Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the General Manager, District Industries Centre.Post-application Process:Step 1: A district-level committee, chaired by the General Manager, DIC, reviews and verifies all applications.Step 2: Eligible artisans are selected based on documents and eligibility norms.
Documents_Required: Aadhaar Card CopyBank Account DetailsOld-Age Pension CertificateBPL CertificateDate of Birth Proof (Birth Certificate or Aadhaar)Certified Copy of Family RegisterProof of Being a Recognized Artisan (Certificate from authorized body)
Search_Keywords: Pension Scheme for Artisans, psfau, Artisans, BPL, Old-age, Pension, Senior Citizen, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Parityakta Pension Scheme
Details: The scheme "Parityakta Pension Scheme" was launched by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Uttarakhand, aims to provide a monthly pension to abandoned married women, mentally ill husbands or wives, and destitute unmarried women in the state. Under this scheme, abandoned married women, mentally ill spouses and destitute unmarried women (above 40 years of age) residing in Uttarakhand who are Below Poverty Line (BPL) cardholders or whose family income from all sources does not exceed Rs4,000/- per month are eligible for the pension. The pension amount is credited to the beneficiary's account within one month from the date of approval.
Benefits: Rs1,200/- per month is provided to abandoned women or unmarried destitute women.Rs1,400/- per month is provided to mentally ill husbands or wives.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.The applicant's total family income should not exceed Rs4,000/- per month or the applicant must belong to a Below Poverty Line (BPL) family. The applicant should fall into one of the following categories:An abandoned married woman (the marriage must be more than one year old, and the husband must have been missing or has abandoned her for more than one year), ORA mentally ill married person (husband or wife), ORAn unmarried, destitute woman aged above 40 years.Note: If a destitute unmarried woman gets married, the applicant will become ineligible.
Application_Process: Online - via CSCsOnlineStep 1: The applicant should gather copies of the necessary documents needed to apply for the concerned scheme.Step 2: The applicant should visit the nearest Common Service Center (CSC) and complete the Biometric Verification Process.Step 3: The applicant should ensure that the CSC agent completes all mandatory fields in the application form and uploads copies of all required documents.Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission and a unique identification number (if applicable).
Documents_Required: Mobile Number of the Applicant.Passport size Photograph (duly attested by Gram Pradhan or BPDO (Block Panchayat Development Officer) for rural areas and Ward Member for urban areas)Aadhaar Card Voter ID CardCBS Bank Account Passbook (linked/seeded with Aadhaar)Valid Family Income Certificate or BPL CertificateCopy of Family Register (only for rural areas)Copy of Resolution Passed in an Open Meeting (Passed by Gram Panchayat in rural areas and Passed by Ward Member in urban areas) Self-declaration (if deserted)Medical Certificate (if spouse is mentally challenged)
Search_Keywords: Parityakta Pension Scheme, dwp, Abandoned, BPL, Deserted, Destitute, Pension, Woman, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Eja-Boi Shagun Yojana
Details: The scheme "Eja-Boi Shagun Yojana" was launched by the Department of Medical Health and Medical Education, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to ensure safe postnatal care and encourage institutional deliveries. Under this scheme, a financial incentive of Rs2,000 /- is provided to mothers who stay in government hospitals for at least 48 hours post-delivery.
Benefits: Mothers receive a Rs2,000/- incentive for delivering in a government hospital and staying for at least 48 hours post-delivery for postnatal care.Note:The incentive amount shall be transferred directly to the beneficiary's bank account.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.The applicant should be a pregnant woman.The delivery should have taken place in a government hospital within Uttarakhand.The mother should stay in the hospital for a minimum of 48 hours after delivery to be eligible for the incentive.
Application_Process: OfflineStep 1: After delivery, the woman should stay in the government hospital for a minimum of 48 hours and inform the hospital staff about her eligibility under the scheme.Step 2: The hospital authorities will collect the necessary documents from the beneficiary.Step 3: The hospital will verify the submitted documents to ensure eligibility and accuracy.Step 4: Once the verification is complete, the hospital will initiate the process to disburse the benefit amount of Rs2,000 directly into the woman's bank account.
Documents_Required: Aadhaar CardBank Account PassbookAny Other Document if Required
Search_Keywords: Eja-Boi Shagun Yojana, ebsy, Child Care, Financial Assistance, Post-delivery, Pregnancy, Pregnant Woman, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Uttarakhand Shaheed Kosh Anudan Yojana
Details: The scheme "Uttarakhand Shaheed Kosh Anudan Yojana" was launched by the Department of Sainik Welfare, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to the widows/dependents of martyrs who lost their lives in internal disturbances or border skirmishes, including personnel from the armed forces and paramilitary forces. Under this scheme, a one-time lump sum grant of Rs10 lakh is provided, based on defined eligibility criteria related to the martyr's family status.
Benefits: Lump Sum Amount: Rs10,00,000 per martyr (one-time)Distribution Criteria:If the martyr is married, 60% to the widow (Veer Nari) and 40% to the parentsIf parents are deceased, 100% to the widowIf the widow is deceased, 40% to parents, 60% equally to dependent childrenIf both the widow and parents are deceased, 100% equally among the dependent childrenIf the widow and children are absent, 100% to the parentsIf unmarried or widower, 100% to parentsMode of Disbursement: Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT)Frequency: One-time
Eligibility: The applicant should be a widow or dependent (Parents/Children) of a martyr.The martyr should have been a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.The martyr should have been a member of the Indian Armed Forces or Paramilitary Forces.The martyrdom should have occurred during:a war,a border clash, oran internal security operation.
Application_Process: OfflineStep 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the District Sainik Kalyan Office and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required).Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the District Sainik Kalyan Office.Step 4: The application is verified at the district level by the Sainik Kalyan authorities.Step 5: Once verified and approved, the sanctioned amount is disbursed via DBT.
Documents_Required: Bank account passbook of the applicantPreliminary report related to the war or incidentPart-II Order issued by the Record Office/Director General's Office regarding the war incidentBattle Casualty Certificate of the martyr soldierDependent Certificate issued by the Record Office/Director General's Office confirming relationship with the martyrDischarge Book of the martyr (if applicable)Identity card of the dependent applying for the grantNon-payment Certificate issued by the District Sainik Welfare and Rehabilitation Office, confirming that no ex-gratia has been paid earlierBattle/Operational Casualty Certificate from:Director General of Paramilitary Forces (for paramilitary cases)Director General of Central Armed Police Forces (for CAPF)
Search_Keywords: Uttarakhand Shaheed Kosh Anudan Yojana, uska, Dependents, Grant, Martyrs, Sainik, Widow, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Minority Self-Employment Scheme
Details: "Minority Self-Employment Scheme" is a social security scheme by the Minority Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provides financial assistance through facilitating loans to the minority community to build their own employment.The benefit of the scheme will be available only on taking a loan , in which 60% has to be borrowed from the bank, 25% is given by the department as grant/subsidy and 15% of the contribution should be with the applicant. The interest on the loan will be charged as per the prevailing rates in the bank.
Benefits: Loan up to Rs10,00,000/-is provided by the corporation through banks,Note: Out of this, 60% is bank loan, 25% is grant/subsidy (minimum Rs25,000/- and maximum Rs2,50,000/-) and 15% is the beneficiary's own share.
Eligibility: Beneficiary should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.Beneficiary should belong to the minority community.The age of the beneficiary should be between 18-55 years of age.The annual income of the beneficiary's family from all sources should not exceed Rs 2,50,000/ - ; Or, the beneficiary's family should belong to the BPL (Below Poverty Level) category.
Application_Process: OfflineStep 1: Applicants should visit their nearest office of the Minorities Welfare Officer/District Social Welfare Officer and collect application form.Step 2:  Fill the form properly and attach all the documents (attested, if required).Step 3: Submit the form at the office of the Minorities Welfare Officer/District Social Welfare Officer.
Documents_Required: Income Certificate/BPL Certificate.Caste Certificate.Permanent Residence Certificate.Aadhaar Card.Bank Account.Project Report.
Search_Keywords: Minority Self-Employment Scheme, msesu, Loan, Minority Welfare, Self Employment, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Loan for Training of Commercial Pilot (GUEEDC)
Details: The scheme "Loan for Training of Commercial Pilot (GUEEDC) implemented by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Gujarat, aims to offers financial support to candidates from the Unreserved category in the form of loan of up to Rs25,00,000/- at a concessional interest rate of 4% per annum to undergo training for obtaining a Commercial Pilot License (CPL). The objective of the scheme is to support meritorious students who aspire to build a career in aviation but face financial constraints.
Benefits: Loan Assistance: Up to Rs25,00,000/- at a concessional interest rate of 4% per annum.
Eligibility: Applicant must be a permanent resident of Gujarat.Applicant must belong to the Unreserved (General) category.Applicant must have passed HSC (12th standard).Applicant must have secured admission to a recognized commercial pilot training institute.
Application_Process: OnlineStep 1: The interested applicant should visit the office of the District Social Welfare Officer and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form.Step 2: In the application form, provide all the mandatory details, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required).Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the supporting documents to the office of the District Social Welfare Officer.Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted.
Documents_Required: Bank Pass Book/Cancelled Cheque.Caste Certificate.Income Certificate.Mark Sheet.Mark sheet of 12th Std.Passport Size Photos.Receipt of fee paid.School Leaving Certificate.
Search_Keywords: Loan for Training of Commercial Pilot (GUEEDC), ltcpg, Commercial Pilot Training, Education Loan, Loan, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Samaveshit Shiksha Yojana
Details: The "Samaveshit Shiksha Yojana" introduced by the Department of Education, Uttarakhand, ensures that children with special needs (Divyang children) enrolled in government schools from Classes 1 to 12 receive equal and inclusive educational opportunities. Under this scheme, students are provided with escort services, home-based education, sports, exposure visits, girl-stipends, and free assistive devices based on their individual needs. Additionally, special camps are organized for the distribution of equipment.
Benefits: Comprehensive Support: Provides various facilities like escort, home-based education, sports, and exposure visits.Financial Assistance: Offers a stipend specifically for girls with special needs.Free Equipment: Provides free assistive devices tailored to the needs of disabled children.Identification and Enrollment: Facilitates the identification of children with special needs (Divyang children) aged 6-18 years and their enrollment in nearby schools.Specialized Educators: Ensures identification is done by trained special teachers at the block level.
Eligibility: The applicant must be a child with special needs.The applicant must be studying in a government school.The applicant must be in Class 1 to Class 12.The applicant must be between 6 and 18 years of age for identification purposes.
Application_Process: OfflineIdentification: Special educators working at the block level identify disabled children aged 6 to 18 years at the beginning of the academic session.Assessment of Needs: Camps are organized for the identification of children with special needs to assess their specific requirements for assistive devices.Enrollment: After identification, children are enrolled in nearby government schools.Device Distribution: Assistive devices are provided free of cost to disabled children based on their needs, often through organized distribution camps.Address and Contact Details:Madhyamik Shiksha Vibhag (Samagra Shiksha) - Rajya Pariyojna, Nanurkheda,Tapovan Marg, Nanurkheda, Raipur, Dehradun.Phone No.: 035-278941, 2781992Helpline No.: 1800-180-4132Email: a spd-ssa-uk@nic.in
Documents_Required: Disability Certificate.Aadhaar Card.Proof of Age.Proof of Residence.Passport-sized Photographs.Any other documents as required.
Search_Keywords: Samaveshit Shiksha Yojana, ssyuk, Assistive Devices, Divyang Student, Education, Escort Services, Learning, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Pashupalan Dhiran Yojana
Details: "Pashupalan Dhiran Yojana" is a welfare initiative by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Gujarat. The scheme aims to support economically disadvantaged individuals from the Rabari and Bharwad communities through financial assistance in the form of low-interest loans up to Rs1,30,000/- for animal husbandry activities.
Benefits: Financial Assistance: Loan up to Rs1,30,000/- for animal husbandry.Note:Loan Amount: 95%Beneficiary Contribution: 5%
Eligibility: The applicant must belong to the Rabari or Bharwad caste, classified under socially and educationally backward classes (SC).The applicant must be between 21 and 45 years of age.The applicant must have a family annual income not exceeding Rs3,00,00/-.The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat.The applicant must be engaged in or intending to undertake animal husbandry activities.
Application_Process: OnlineStep 1: Visit the official DAADC online portal.Step 2: Register/log in using your credentials.Step 3: Fill out the application form with accurate personal and scheme-specific details.Step 4: Upload the required documents and submit.
Documents_Required: Aadhar Card.Age Proof.Attested copy of PAN Card.Bank Pass Book/Cancelled Cheque.Birth Certificate.Caste Certificate.Income Certificate.Ration Card.School Leaving	Certificate.True Copy of Electricity Bill.
Search_Keywords: Pashupalan Dhiran Yojana, pdyg, Animal Husbandry, Farmer, Loan, SC, Scheduled Caste, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Financial Assistance Scheme for Dependents of Deceased Journalists and Litterateurs - Rajasthan
Details: The "Financial Assistance Scheme for Dependents of Deceased Journalists and Litterateurs" scheme was launched by the Department of Information & Public Relations (DIPR), Government of Rajasthan. The scheme aims to provide financial support to the dependents of deceased journalists and litterateurs in situations such as medical emergencies, unemployment, or when there is no other source of income. Eligible dependents under this scheme include an unemployed son below the age of 28 years, an unmarried daughter, the wife, and the parents of the deceased, provided they do not have any other means of financial support.Scheme ImplementationThe scheme is implemented by a committee constituted by the state government and managed under the Rajasthan Journalist and Litterateur Welfare Fund. The objective is to promote social security and ensure the well-being of media personnel and literary contributors in Rajasthan.Under the scheme, illness covers:Cancer, leprosy, valve replacement, angioplasty, bypass surgery, kidney transplant, brain stroke (brain and neurological diseases), epileptic seizures, severe injury in an accident, severe infectious diseases - brain infection, lung infection/pneumonia, severe infection in other organs of the body, general surgery - (hernia, appendix, stones in kidney and gall bladder), pregnancy (cesarean) and serious gynecological diseases, diseases related to excessive bleeding, paralysis/palsy, asthma, Alzheimer's, COVID-19, thyroid, etc.
Benefits: Monetary Assistance for Medical Treatment:Up to Rs1,00,000/- for treatment of critical diseases (e.g., cancer, bypass surgery, kidney transplant, brain stroke, etc.).In special cases, the committee may approve up to Rs2,00,000/-.Monthly Financial Assistance:Rs1,000/- to Rs2,500/- per month for a maximum of one year.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a dependent of a deceased journalist or litterateur.The deceased journalist or litterateur should have been a resident of Rajasthan.The applicant should fall under one of the following categories:Widow of the deceased journalist or litterateur with no other source of income.Unemployed son below 28 years of age.Unmarried daughter.Father or mother of the deceased, provided they have no other source of income.Note: Financial assistance will be given to only one person at a time.
Application_Process: OfflineApplication ProcessStep 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the Director, Directorate of Information & Public Relations, Rajasthan Government, Jaipur and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required).Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Director, Directorate of Information & Public Relations, Rajasthan Government, Jaipur.Post Application Process:All applications will be reviewed by the Rajasthan Journalist Welfare Fund Committee.Upon verifying eligibility and other necessary details, the Committee will issue appropriate orders, which will be implemented by the Member Secretary.
Documents_Required: Identity ProofMedical Reports and Prescription (If applicable)Proof of incomeBank Passbook CopyAny Other Document if Required
Search_Keywords: Financial Assistance Scheme for Dependents of Deceased Journalists and Litterateurs - Rajasthan, fasfjd, Deceased Journalists, Dependent, Financial Assistance, Journalist, Litterateur, Medical Assistance, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Jan Samuh Bima Yojana
Details: The scheme "Jan Samuh Bima Yojana" was launched in 2019 by the Department of Tribal Area Development, Government of Rajasthan. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to Sahariya families in the event of the death of the heads of the families (primary earning member). Under this scheme, a one-time financial assistance is provided by the insurance company to the deceased's family to help reduce their economic burden. The heads of these families are insured under the Swachh Project, and the insurance premium is paid by the Swachh Project.
Benefits: Financial Assistance: The insurance company provides financial assistance of Rs25,000/- to the family in case of death of the insured person.Insurance Premium: Fully paid under the Swachh Project.
Eligibility: The applicant should be native Rajasthan.The applicant should be a family member or dependent of the deceased person. The deceased person should belong to the Sahariya community.The deceased person should be a resident of the Baran district, Rajasthan.The insured person must be registered under the scheme before death.
Application_Process: OfflineSurvey & Selection:A survey is conducted by the Swachh Project in Sahariya bastis of Baran district to identify eligible families.Enrollment:Eligible families members are enrolled under the insurance scheme by the Swachh Project.Submission of Claim (in case of death of the insured):The family must submit the required documents to the Swachh Project office at Shahabad.The documents are verified and forwarded to the insurance company.
Documents_Required: Caste Certificate Domicile CertificateDeath Certificate of the insured personCopy of Bank PassbookAadhaar Card
Search_Keywords: Jan Samuh Bima Yojana, jsby, Death, Financial Assistance, Insurance, Sahariya Community, Swachh Project, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Indira Gandhi Matritva Poshan Yojana
Details: The scheme "Indira Gandhi Matritva Poshan Yojana (IGMPY)" was implemented on 1st November 2020 by the Department of Women and Child Development, Government of Rajasthan, in five tribal districts of the state. The scheme aims to improve maternal and child nutrition, encourage institutional deliveries, and reduce maternal and infant mortality in tribal regions of the state. Under this scheme, a conditional cash benefit is provided to pregnant and lactating women for their second child, ensuring proper nutrition and healthcare.Scheme ImplementationThe scheme is implemented by the Integrated Child Development Services (ICDS) under the Department of Women and Child Development. Area's CoverIt primarily covers women in Banswara, Dungarpur, Pratapgarh, Udaipur, and Baran districts.
Benefits: Financial Assistance:A financial assistance of Rs6,000/- is provided in five conditional installments to the beneficiary.InstallmentConditionsAmountFirst InstallmentOn pregnancy registration at Anganwadi Centre and health check-up within 120 days (4 months) of pregnancy.Rs1000Second InstallmentAfter completion of second antenatal check-up during the 6th month of pregnancy.Rs1000Second InstallmentUpon delivery at a government or empanelled private hospital and registration of child's birth.Rs1000Second InstallmentOn successful administration of 3 key immunizations (BCG, OPV, DPT, Hepatitis B) within 105 days of birth.Rs2000Second InstallmentAfter administration of measles vaccinations and child weight measurement at 9th monthsRs1000Validity:Valid only for the birth of second child.Mode of Disbursement:Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to the beneficiary's bank account.NOTE:Beneficiaries who miss a stage's requirements won't receive payment for it. However, fulfilling later stage conditions will make them eligible for subsequent payments.
Eligibility: 1.	The applicant should be a married woman.2.	The applicant should be a permanent resident of one of the five tribal districts of Rajasthan: Pratapgarh, Dungarpur, Banswara, Udaipur, or Baran.3.	Woman will be eligible if they meet either of the following conditions:She become pregnant with her second child on or after 1st November 2020.She has registered her first antenatal check-up (ANC) for the second child after 1st November 2020.4.	Pregnant or lactating woman working as Anganwadi worker, Anganwadi helper, Asha Sahayogi, or Saathin will also be eligible under the scheme, subject to fulfillment of the scheme's conditions.5.	In the event of abortion or stillbirth, the beneficiary woman will remain eligible for the scheme if she conceives again in the future.6. The applicant should deliver her child at a government health facility or an empanelled private health institution.7. The applicant should not have more than two living children.Notes:Eligible beneficiaries will receive cash assistance in addition to benefits from other central and state government schemes such as Janani Suraksha Yojana (JSY) and Rajshree Yojana.The date of pregnancy will be calculated based on the last menstrual period (LMP) recorded in the Pregnancy and Child Tracking System (PCTS) online portal maintained by the Medical and Health Department.If a beneficiary does not comply with any phase of the scheme, the payment for that phase will be withheld. However, if the beneficiary meets the conditions of subsequent phases, the payment for those phases will be disbursed accordingly.The applicant must complete all health milestones and ensure the child's immunizations are done as per the schedule.
Application_Process: OfflineApplication ProcessThis primarily applies to women pregnant with their second child on or after November 1st, 2020.Step 1: The applicant visits your local Anganwadi center and registers their second pregnancy (This should ideally be done within 120 days of your Last Menstrual Period (LMP) to be eligible for the first installment).Step 2: During registration at the Anganwadi center, you must provide your Jan-Aadhaar/Bhamashah ID and your mobile phone number. This is crucial for your details to be recorded in the PCTS (Pregnancy and Child Tracking System).NOTE:If you do not have a Jan-Aadhaar ID, you will need to obtain one. The Anganwadi worker will inform and guide you on how to do this, potentially directing you to e-Mitra centers or the online portal.Cooperate with the Anganwadi worker and ASHA Sahyogini/ANM for the recording of your pregnancy details, check-ups, delivery information, and child's immunization details in the PCTS.Anganwadi Worker Role:Identify and ensure eligible beneficiaries fulfill the scheme's conditions (as per points 2 & 3 of the guidelines).Ensure pregnant women get their first ANC registered in PCTS within 120 days of their last menstrual period.Ensure services are fully recorded in the RCH register and the JSY case closure form is submitted on PCTS by the 15th of each month.For private facility check-ups, ensure the ANM records it in the Mamta card for PCTS visibility.For institutional deliveries outside listed centers, collect the self-declaration form and provide one copy to the ASHA/ANM for PCTS entry.Assist the Woman Supervisor in verifying beneficiary eligibility.Inform and encourage beneficiaries without Jan-Aadhaar to obtain one.Submit amendment forms for any discrepancies found in PCTS data.ASHA Sahyogini/ANM Role:Ensure services are fully recorded in the RCH register.Submit the JSY case closure form on PCTS by the 15th of each month for eligible IGMPY beneficiaries.Record private facility check-ups in the Mamta card for PCTS visibility.Enter details from the self-declaration form into PCTS for deliveries in non-listed private facilities.Ensure family planning details are entered into PCTS by the 15th of each month.Woman Supervisor (LS) Role:Verify eligible women based on PCTS data against scheme rules in their Rajposhan web login.Initially, manually verify using printouts and Anganwadi worker assistance.Approve or reject beneficiary eligibility with reasons in Rajposhan.Ensure the beneficiary is registered at the correct Anganwadi center, is eligible, and has complete data in PCTS.Report reasons for ineligibility in Rajposhan.Submit amendment forms for data discrepancies in Rajposhan.Update beneficiary Jan-Aadhaar, bank details, IFSC code, and mobile number in Rajposhan based on amendment forms.Continuously monitor if new beneficiary registration forms are entered into PCTS.Enter data for new beneficiaries in Rajposhan (for lifting purposes initially).Verify the linking of the beneficiary's bank account to their Jan-Aadhaar via the Rajposhan portal.Amend beneficiary names in Rajposhan to match Jan-Aadhaar.Child Development Project Officer (CDPO) Role:Review and approve/reject beneficiary data for installment payments based on the Woman Supervisor's verification report.
Documents_Required: Pregnancy Registration Slip (issued by Anganwadi Centre)Bank Passbook Copy (linked with Aadhaar for DBT)Residential ProofMaternity Health Check-Up Cards (to track antenatal milestones)Delivery CertificateChild's Birth CertificateChild Immunization Record/Health CardBhamashah Card or Jan Aadhaar Card

Scheme_Name: Cash Amount for Encouraging Scheduled Tribe Sportsperson Students
Details: The scheme " Cash Amount for Encouraging Scheduled Tribe Sportsperson Students" was launched in 1996 by the Department of Tribal Area Development, Government of Rajasthan. It aims to promote and encourage sports participation among Scheduled Tribe (ST) students residing in scheduled areas of Rajasthan. Under this scheme, cash awards, certificates, and mementos are provided as a form of encouragement to Scheduled Tribe sportspersons students who secure the top three positions in national and international sports events.
Benefits: Students who have secured top positions at national and international levels are rewarded with the following incentives as a form of encouragement:Cash PrizeCertificate of AppreciationMemento
Eligibility: The applicant should be a student.The applicant should be a resident of Scheduled Tribe area of Rajasthan.The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Tribe category.The applicant should participate in a national or international-level sports competition. The applicant should have secured a top-three position at national or international level competition.
Application_Process: OfflineStep 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the office and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications:For districts under Tribal Sub-Plan: Commissioner, Tribal Area Development Department / Deputy Commissioner, Tribal Area Development DepartmentFor non-TSP (Tribal Sub-Plan) areas: Chief Executive Officer, Zila Parishad.Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required).Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Concerned Tribal Area Development Department office/Chief Executive Officer, Zila Parishad.
Documents_Required: Caste CertificateAadhar CardDomicile Certificate (Proof of residence in a Scheduled Tribe area)Sports Achievement Certificate(s)Any Other Document if Required

Scheme_Name: Operation of Ashram Hostels
Details: The scheme "Operation of Ashram Hostels" was launched by the Department of Tribal Area Development, Government of Rajasthan. It aims to ensure continued education for tribal students who lack access to nearby higher-level schools due to the poor economic condition of their families. Under this scheme, free accommodation, nutritious meals, educational materials, uniforms, personal hygiene items, and other facilities are provided to Scheduled Tribe (ST) students residing in ashram hostels operated by the Tribal Area Development Department.
Benefits: Students are provided with the following annually and monthly benefits:Annually (per student):School uniform with stitchingShoes, socks, towel, and warm sweaterMonthly (per student):Nutritious breakfast and mealsHair oilBathing and washing soapHair cutting serviceLaundry for bed linen (sheet, pillow cover, blanket)Electricity and water facilitiesNewspapers and magazines
Eligibility: The applicant should be a native of Rajasthan.The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Tribe community.Scheduled Tribe students are eligible if there is no primary school within 1.5 km, no upper primary school within 3 km, and no secondary/higher secondary school within 5 km of their residence.The parents/guardians should not be an income tax payee.The applicant's family should not own more than 400 square yards of urban land.The applicant's family should not own more than 15 bighas of agricultural land.The student should pass the current academic year to continue enrollment in the next year.The student should be a resident of the same district in which the hostel application has been made.Notes:All new admissions will be made on the basis of merit.Admission to hostels in specific tribal areas will be given only to tribal students belonging to the same area.Re-admission in the next academic year will be granted only if the student passes the annual examination.
Application_Process: Online - via CSCsStep 1: The applicant should gather copies of the necessary documents needed to apply for the concerned scheme.Step 2: The applicant should visit the nearest E-Mitra Center and complete the Biometric Verification Process.Step 3: The applicant should ensure that the E-Mitra Center agent completes all mandatory fields in the application form and uploads copies of all required documents.Step 4: Keep the receipt or acknowledgment form for future reference.Note:All new admissions will be made on the basis of merit.Admission to hostels in specific tribal areas will be given only to tribal students belonging to the same area.Re-admission in the next academic year will be granted only if the student passes the annual examination.
Documents_Required: Caste CertificateEducation Qualification Marksheet/CertificateIncome CertificateJan Aadhar/Bhamashah Card

Scheme_Name: Samuhik Kanya Vivah Sahayata Yojana (UKBOCWWB)
Details: The scheme "Samuhik Kanya Vivah Sahayata Yojana" was launched by the Labour Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance and support for the marriage of daughters of registered construction workers through organized group marriage events. The scheme is implemented by the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Uttarakhand.
Benefits: Monetary Assistance to Beneficiary:Financial assistance of Rs61,000/- will be provided.Attire Allowance to the Couple:Rs5,000/- will be provided to each bride and groom for purchasing their wedding clothes.Support to Organizers:Rs10,000/- per couple will be disbursed to the organizers for conducting the group marriage ceremony.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a resident of Uttarakhand.The applicant should be a registered construction worker under the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Uttarakhand.The applicant should register for the scheme at least 15 days prior to the scheduled date of the group marriage.The bride must be at least 18 years of age, and the groom must be at least 21 years of age.The applicant should not have availed similar benefits under any other government department.
Application_Process: Online - via CSCsOfflineFor New Registration under the UKBOCWWB:Step 1: To become a beneficiary, a construction worker who has completed 18 years of age and has not completed 60 years, has worked as a construction worker for at least 90 days during the preceding 01 year, can register himself/herself.Step 2: The eligible worker may visit the nearest Jan Seva Kendra or Shramik Suvidha Kendra along with all the relevant documents for online registration.Step 3: Upon successful registration, the applicant will receive a Registration Number for future reference.Step 4: The applicant can also track the status of their application online by visiting the official website: https://ukbocw.uk.gov.in/DynamicPages/LabourSearch-hi.aspxNote 1: After verification of the application, the photo identity card will be issued by the registration officer.Note 2: Registration will be done free of cost, which will be valid for three years and after the completion of three years, only Rs100/- contribution will be required to be deposited by the construction worker for every next three years.Application Process for Welfare Scheme Benefits:Step 1: To avail the benefits of the scheme, the eligible applicant may visit the nearest Shram Suvidha Kendra along with all the relevant documents.Step 2: Upon successful submission of the application form, the applicant will receive an Application Number for future reference.Step 3: The applicant can also track the status of their application online by visiting the official website: https://ukbocw.uk.gov.in/DynamicPages/LabourSchemeSearch.aspxNOTE: The Aadhaar authentication of the bride is mandatory.
Documents_Required: Aadhaar Card of the daughter (mandatory for Aadhaar authentication)Proof of Age (Birth Certificate/School Leaving Certificate/Self-attested copy of Family Register, any one)Self-attested copy of the marriage cardA certificate issued by the local head/tehsildar/sarpanch verifying the marriage and authenticity of the applicantSelf-Declaration Certificate (the applicant confirming that no assistance has been availed under similar schemes from any other department)

Scheme_Name: Gargi Sanskrit Girl Student Scholarship Scheme
Details: The "Gargi Sanskrit Girl Student Scholarship Scheme" implemented by the Department of Sanskrit Education, Uttarakhand, aims to support and encourage girl students enrolled in Sanskrit schools in Uttarakhand by offering them a fixed monthly scholarship. Under this scheme, eligible girls from Class 6 to Class 12 studying in recognized Sanskrit institutions receive Rs251/- per month, totaling Rs3,012/- annually. This initiative targets 175 students every year and promotes gender equity in classical language education.
Benefits: Scholarship Amount: Monthly Rs251/- (Rs3,012/- annually) to eligible students.
Eligibility: The applicant must be femaleThe applicant must be a student.The applicant must be studying in Class 6 to 12.The applicant must be enrolled in a Sanskrit school or college in Uttarakhand.
Application_Process: OfflineStep 1: Eligible students enrolled in Class 6 to 12 must gather required documents and submit them to the principal of their Sanskrit school or college.Step 2: The principal forwards the application to the Assistant Director, Sanskrit Education, Uttarakhand.Step 3: The Assistant Director verifies and forwards eligible applications to the Director.Step 4: The Director finalizes the applications, and the scholarships are disbursed online.Address and Contact Details:Sanskrit Shiksha VibhagUttarakhand Sanskrit Academy, Haridwar - Sanskrit Bhavanam, Ranipuhjalam, Jwalapur, HaridwaramPhone: 983749064E-mail: uksa 2002@qmail.comUttarakhand Sanskrit Vishwavidyalaya, Haridwar - Bahadrabad, Haridwar, Delhi Rashtriya Rajmarg, P.O. Bahadrabad, HaridwarPhone: 035-2665054E-mail: registrar@usw.ac.in, ssnuk2011@gmail.com
Documents_Required: Aadhaar Card.Bank Account details.Any other documents as required.

Scheme_Name: National Centre for Communication Security (NCCS) Research Associates Scheme
Details: Applications are invited based upon vacancy at NCCS ( usually twice a year). Currently, no applications are being invited. Please follow NCCS website for next Research Associate (RA) engagement notification. Click here for last RA notification.National Centre for Communication Security (NCCS) responsible for the implementation of ComSeC Scheme part of MTCTE. This involves development of Indian Telecom Security Assurance Standards, Security Test labs recognition and Security certification of telecom equipment and associated processes. This mandate is of significant importance considering the looming telecom/network/cyber threats globally and the threat these vulnerabilities pose to National Security and Privacy to people of the Nation. NCCS work in security domain to strengthen the security standardization eco-system in India is highly specialized in nature and unique in its mandate. It also needs to interact with multilateral agencies like 3GPP, ITU, APT, IEEE, IETF, NIST and ETSI and other national/ international standardization bodies for active collaboration & development of country specific telecom security standards for India. It develops expertise to imbibe latest technologies and provides technical support/ policy inputs to DOT to advice other ministries in respects of Telecom Security Domain. PositionsThe number of positions available depends upon the vacancies. Please refer to the RA Notification for vacancy details.The total number of RAs at NCCS at any point of time can not be more than 18.NCCS reserves the right not to fill up all or any of the positions, if it so desires.Period of engagementInitially for a period of 2 years, extendable by one more year, on the recommendations of Performance Appraisal Committee. Brief Description of Work and ResponsibilitiesThe RAs will be primarily engaged for in-depth study, formulation, operationalization and assessment of various security standards ITSARs preparation, TSTPs preparation/programmes/ projects/ policies evaluation of test reports/DUTs etc. related to emerging ICT areas such as Telecom, Network and Cyber Security, 4G/5G Networks, Virtualisation Function & Operating Systems Expertise, Cloud Security, Source Code Analysis, Cryptography, Internet of Things, Smart Networks, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, new developments in the fields of Mobile Technologies and any associated field deemed fit by NCCS. They will also be associated in preparation of contributions for various international standardization organizations such as International Telecommunication Union (ITU) Study Groups, APT, IEEE, IEC etc. Further, they will also be engaged in various works emerging from ComSec Scheme, new National Digital Communication Policy (NDCP) - 2018The RAs would The RA would be attached with one of the Divisions of the NCCS and required to provide high quality work. Depending on the requirements of NCCS and candidate's personal skills, RAs can be rotated to other divisions within NCCS. Place of postingThe place of posting will be NCCS, City Telephone Exchange, Sampangirama Nagar, Bengaluru 560027.
Benefits: RemunerationA consolidated amount of Rs. 75,000/- per month on pro rata basis, all-inclusive (including taxes), will be paid to every RA. There shall be an annual increase of Rs. 7,500/- subject to satisfactory performance.RA shall submit execute bond as prescribed in the Advertisement.
Eligibility: Essential QualificationBachelor Degree in Electronics/ Communications/Telecommunications/ Information Technology/ Computers/ Electrical Engineering (with majors in electronics/communications/computers) or related discipline with minimum 60% marks or equivalent CGPA.Desirable Qualification('Annexure' mentioned below may be seen in the latest RA notification published on NCCS website.)Preference/weightage will be given to following qualifications as per details given in Annexure-II of the RA Notification. Valid Gate Score in Electronics and Communication Engineering/ Computer Science and Information Technology Subjects or related discipline with minimum score as per Annexure II.Post-Graduation/ Master Degree in Electronics/ Communications/Telecommunications/ Information Technology/ Computers or related discipline with minimum 60% marks (with valid Gate Score at the time of admission). PhD Degree in relevant fields.(a) Work experience of one year or more in the relevant field as defined in Annexure VII or (b) Successful Internship certificate of six month or more with NCCS/TEC.Age LimitCandidates age should be below 28 years for Graduates/BE/BTech, 30 Years Post Graduates/MTech/MS and 35 years for PhD as on as on date of Notification.Note : A candidate who declines to join after the offer of appointment is issued by NCCS shall be debarred from appointment in 2 subsequent notifications issued by NCCS.
Application_Process: OfflineOnlineInterested and eligible candidates may submit their applications along with their CVs, areas of work interest in the prescribed application form (Attached at Annexure-I) accompanied by the self-attested copies of the academic and experiencecertificate/testimonials, to NCCS in response to advertisement/ notification from NCCS.The willing and eligible applicant may send their duly filled application in the prescribed Proforma (Annexure-I of Scheme Enclosed) along with other required documents by post or submit personally to the address:ADET (SC & HQ), Room 301, National Centre for Communications Security,2nd Floor, City Telephone Exchange, Sampangirama Nagar, Bangalore - 560027 on or before the last date as mentioned in the RA notification. Delayed/incomplete applications will be rejected summarily.In case of any query, e-mail be dropped at adethq.nccs-dot@gov.in.
Documents_Required: (Self-attested copies)1. Mark-sheet of Class 10th / Date of Birth proof2. Mark-sheet of Engineering Graduation3. Mark-sheet of Engineering Post-Graduation (if applicable)4. GATE Score card (if available)5. Documentary proof of CGPA to Percentage conversion norm (if applicable)6. Work experience/ Internship Certificate (if available)7. PhD Certificate (if applicable)8. Any other document to support candidate application

Scheme_Name: Financial Assistance to Sports Associations/ Clubs/ Committees of Uttarakhand
Details: The scheme "Financial Assistance to Sports Associations/ Clubs/ Committees of Uttarakhand" implemented by the Department Of Sports, Uttarakhand, aims to provide financial grants to recognized sports associations, clubs, and sports committees in the state for organizing competitions at national, state, and district levels. The assistance includes up to Rs3,50,000/- for national-level competitions, Rs2,50,000/- for state-level competitions, and Rs1,00,00/- for district-level competitions. Additionally, selected athletes for international competitions may receive up to Rs2,50,000/-. The scheme also includes grants for the procurement of sports equipment, supporting nearly 20 sports bodies and athletes annually.
Benefits: For Organizing Sports Competitions:National-level competitions: Up to Rs3,50,000/-.State-level competitions: Up to Rs2,50,000/-.District-level competitions: Up to Rs1,00,00/-.For Players (Financial Aid/Equipment): Financial assistance of up to Rs2,50,000/- is provisioned for selected players, which can be utilized for purposes such as purchasing sports equipment.
Eligibility: The Sports Association/ Club/ Sports Committee must be officially recognized by the Uttarakhand State Sports Department.
Application_Process: OfflineProposal Preparation: The recognized sports association, club, or committee must prepare a detailed proposal for organizing a sports competition or procuring sports equipment.Submission: The completed application, along with all necessary supporting documents, must be submitted to the relevant authority within the Sports Department of Uttarakhand.Selection/Approval: For grants related to national/international competitions and for player financial aid/equipment, selection and approval are made in accordance with detailed departmental rules.Disbursement: Upon successful approval, the sanctioned funds are disbursed to the beneficiary.
Documents_Required: Official Recognition Certificate.Registration documents of the organization.Detailed proposal for the sports competition (including budget, schedule, expected participation, and objectives).Any other documents as required.
Search_Keywords: Financial Assistance to Sports Associations/ Clubs/ Committees of Uttarakhand, fasaccu, Athlete Support, Sports Association, Sports Club, Sports Grant, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Chanakya Scheme for Swayam Upadhi
Details: Andhra Pradesh Brahmin Welfare Corporation (ABC) Limited, a Government of Andhra Pradesh undertaking is introducing the "Chanakya Scheme for Swayam Upadhi" (CS-SU) to encourage Brahmin entrepreneurs in Andhra Pradesh. Under this scheme, one-time financial assistance upto Rs2,00,000/- (not exceeding 50% of the project cost) for projects costing between Rs3,00,000/- and Rs10,00,000/- will be considered. Objective:To encourage Brahmins to set up Micro Enterprises in Andhra Pradesh in various sectors like Catering, Education, Electronics, Healthcare (Clinic, Diagnostics, Pharmacy, Physiotherapy), Engineering, IT & ITES (Coaching, Development, DTP, Repairs), Photography /Videography, Pooja Materials, Retail, Ritual Tools and equipment, Solar, Telecom, Textiles, etc.
Benefits: One-time financial assistance upto Rs2,00,000/-. NOTE: Not exceeding 50% of the project cost.
Eligibility: The applicant should belong to the Brahmin community.The applicant should reside in any of the 13 districts of Andhra Pradesh.The applicant should have set up the enterprise in Andhra Pradesh.The applicant's age should be 50 years or below.  The applicant should have a zeal to become a successful entrepreneur.
Application_Process: OnlineRegistration and applyStep 01: Applicants have to visit the official website(https://www.andhrabrahmin.ap.gov.in/schemes/schemes.aspx#) and click on "Scheme"Step 02: Click on "Registration" After that application form will openStep 03: Fill out the required details:Personal Details: Name, Residence address, Aadhaar no, Ration card no, Bank detail etcUpload: Photo, Signature and Certificate Details Documents: Birth Certificate, Residential Certificate, Aadhar Card, Caste Certificate, Bank Passbook etcFinalize and "Submit" the application.Step-4: After submission receive the reference number. Check Application Status:Step 01: Click on the "Services" link on the menu and select "Know your status".Step 02: Enter the Reference or Mobile or Aadhaar Card Number to get the application status.Step 03: Select the "Financial Year" and Fetch the details. Download the Acknowledgement slip:Step 01: Click on the "Acknowledgement Slip"Step 02: Enter the Aadhaar Card Number and select the "Scheme"Step 03: Click on the "Submit"
Documents_Required: Aadhar Card of the Applicant. Valid Income Certificate (issued by competent authority not earlier than 6 months. Caste Certificate (issued by RI / MRO). Senior Secondary Pass Certificate/Birth Certificate. Certificate of Highest Qualification of the Applicant. Passport-size Photographs.  Detailed Project Report (DPR) on the Proposed Project. Write-up covering how his passion, interests, and capabilities match the business proposal.Bank statement of previous six months. A reference from a registered Brahmin organization or a Brahmin of eminence (Retired IAS/IPS/IFS Officer, Retired High Court Judge, Retired Professor/VC of any University, Chartered Accountant, Reputed Doctor /Industrialist, Bank employee retired in senior position, etc.), citing his passion, interests, and capabilities.

Scheme_Name: Braille Equipment Provision
Details: The "Braille Equipment Provision"  scheme aims to facilitate the independent functioning of visually impaired individuals by providing them with Braille equipment for writing, computing, entertainment, and mobility. Through this scheme, Braille devices are manufactured and distributed at subsidized rates to persons with visual disabilities and institutions like special schools. The scheme is implemented by the National Institute for the Empowerment of Persons with Visual Disabilities, Dehradun,
Benefits: Subsidized Access of Braille Appliances: Makes Braille equipment affordable by providing it at subsidized rates to visually impaired persons, special schools, and institutions.
Eligibility: A person with visual impairment/ a Special School/ Organisation serving visually impaired persons shall be eligible under this scheme.
Application_Process: OfflineStep 1: The interested applicant should fill in the order format with all required details such as item names, quantities, and rates, and submit it along with the payment through Bank Draft, NEFT, or RTGS.Step 2: The order will be confirmed after receiving the payment through Bank Draft/ NEFT/ RTGS in the name of Director NIVH, 116-Rajpur Road, Dehradun, along with 10% Packing charges extra on the actual cost of the appliances and Freight charges extra (as applicable). Rates are inclusive of 5% G.S.T.FOR FURTHER DETAILS PLEASE CONTACT:Workshop For Manufacturing Braille Appliances (MBA)National Institute for the Empowerment ofPersons with Visual Disabilities (Divyangjan)116-Rajpur Road, Dehradun - 248 001 (Uttarakhand)Phone: 0135 -2742145, 2744491E-mail: director-niepvd@nivh.gov.inmbaniepvd@gmail.comVisit us at: www.nivh.gov.in
Documents_Required: Disability Certificate.Unique Disability ID (UDID) Card.Aadhaar Card.

Scheme_Name: Livelihood Opportunity Promotion Scheme (Scheduled Tribes)
Details: The "Livelihood Opportunity Promotion Scheme (Scheduled Tribe)" scheme was launched by the Social Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand. It aims to promote sustainable self-employment and income generation among Scheduled Tribe individuals by supporting viable livelihood projects. Under this scheme, financial assistance, including a bank loan is provided to the beneficiaries for setting up income-generating units with a total project cost between Rs50,000 and Rs2,00,000.
Benefits: Financial Assistance:Project Cost: Between Rs50,000/- and Rs2,00,000/-.Bank Loan: 60% of the project costMargin Money: 30% of the project cost, repayable at 7% annual interest in 60 monthly installmentsGrant: Up to Rs50,000/-.Beneficiary Contribution:No contribution for project cost up to Rs1,00,000/-10% contribution for project cost between Rs1,01,000/- and Rs2,00,000/-
Eligibility: The applicant must be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Tribe (ST) category.The applicant's age must be between 18 and 50 years.The applicant's annual family income should not exceed Rs2,50,000/-.
Application_Process: OfflineApplication Process:Step 1: The interested applicant downloads the application form from the official website. Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required).Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the office of the Vikas Khand (Block Development) Office. Selection Process:Step 1: The application will be forwarded to the District Social Welfare Officer.Step 2: A District-Level Committee, headed by the District Social Welfare Officer, will review the proposals and select beneficiaries.
Documents_Required: Passport-size PhotographVoter IDAadhaar CardDisability Certificate (If applicable)Caste Certificate (If applicable)Any Other Document if Required

Scheme_Name: Livelihood Opportunity Promotion Scheme (Scheduled Caste)
Details: The Social Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand, launched the "Livelihood Opportunity Promotion Scheme (Scheduled Caste)" scheme. It aims to promote self-employment and income generation among Scheduled Caste individuals by supporting small businesses and livelihood projects. Under this scheme, financial assistance in the form of bank loans, margin money, and grants is provided to the beneficiaries for projects ranging from Rs50,000/- to Rs2,00,000/-.
Benefits: Financial Assistance:Project Cost Limit: Rs50,000/- to Rs2,00,000/-Bank Loan: 60% of the project costMargin Money: 30% of the project cost (payable with applicable interest over 60 monthly installments)Grant: Maximum of Rs10,000/-Beneficiary Contribution:No contribution for project cost up to Rs1,00,000/-10% contribution for project cost between Rs1,01,000/- and Rs2,00,000/-.
Eligibility: The applicant must be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Caste category.The applicant's age must be between 18 and 50 years.The applicant's annual income must not exceed Rs1,05,600/- for rural areas and Rs1,29,840/- for urban areas.
Application_Process: OfflineApplication Process:Step 1: The interested applicant downloads the application form from the official website. Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required).Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the office of the Vikas Khand (Block Development) Office. Selection Process:Step 1: The application will be forwarded to the District Social Welfare Officer.Step 2: A District-Level Committee, headed by the District Social Welfare Officer, will review the proposals and select beneficiaries.
Documents_Required: Identity & Address Proof (Aadhaar Card, Voter ID / Ration Card / Driving License).Caste & Residence Verification (Caste Certificate, Domicile Certificate or valid residential proof )Income Proof and Financial Documents.Other additional Documents (If require).
Search_Keywords: Livelihood Opportunity Promotion Scheme (Scheduled Caste), lopssc, Financial Assistance, Loan, Scheduled Caste, Self-Employment, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: License for Repairers of Weights-Measures and Weighing Instruments
Details: The scheme "License for Repairers of Weights-Measures and Weighing Instruments" was introduced by the Department of Food, Civil Supplies and Consumer Affairs, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote self-employment opportunities by enabling skilled individuals to legally engage in the repair and maintenance of weights and measuring instruments used in trade. Under this scheme, the applicants are issued a government license that allows them to legally operate as certified repairers of weighing and measuring instruments used by traders.
Benefits: Issuance of a government license authorizing the applicant to legally repair weights and measuring devices used in trades.Enables applicants to start or continue self-employment as certified repairers under the Legal Metrology Act.
Eligibility: The applicant must be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.The applicant must have access to a valid business premises for carrying out repair work.The applicant must possess one of the following qualifications:ITI (Electronics) or its equivalent along with 2 years of relevant experience; orDiploma in Electronics, Instrumentation, or Electrical Engineering with 1 year of relevant experience; orB.Sc. degree with Physics and 1 year of relevant experience; orB.E./B.Tech degree in Electrical, Electronics, or Instrumentation Engineering.
Application_Process: OnlineStep 1: Visit the official website: https://investuttarakhand.uk.gov.in/.Step 2: Register or log in as an applicant.Step 3: Select FCS Legal Metrology under the Legal Metrology Department.Step 4: Choose the service License for Repairer of Weights and Measures.Step 5: Fill out the application form with all required personal and business details.Step 6: Upload all required documents as listed.Step 7: Pay the prescribed fee (Rs100) online.Step 8: Submit the form and get the application ID.Step 9: The application will be forwarded to the designated inspector.Step 10: An on-site inspection will be scheduled and conducted.Step 11: Upon satisfactory inspection and document verification, the license will be issued online.
Documents_Required: Aadhaar Card PAN CardAddress Proof of Business Premises (such as Electricity Bill)Ownership Proof of Business Premises (such as Rent Agreement or Property Registration Copy)Educational Qualification CertificatesExperience Certificate (1 or 2 years as applicable to the qualification)
