Scheme_Name: Awarding Teleeducation Scholarships To Afghan Students
Details: The "Awarding Teleeducation Scholarships To Afghan Students" scheme under e-VidyaBharati Network Project, launched by the Ministry of External Affairs in October 2019, aims to provide 1000 scholarships annually to Afghan students for pursuing various UGC-approved online Undergraduate and Postgraduate programs from Indian universities. It promotes India as a global hub for higher education and enables Afghan nationals to receive quality education in fields such as Business Administration, Commerce, Computer Science, Arts, and more.Tenure of scholarship:It should be the endeavor of each student to complete the UG, PG, programmes within prescribed time period of 3 years, 2 years, respectively. However, any relaxation will be strictly as per UGC guidelines.
Benefits: The scholarship amount covers the entire degree programme fee including:Tuition fees,Admission fees,Examination fees,E-content charges,Other charges like registration fee, re-examination, and award of degree, etc.Note: The passed students are awarded Degree online and physical copies of degrees/certificates are also sent to Indian Mission in Kabul, and students need to collect from Indian Mission in Kabul.
Eligibility: The applicant must be a national of Afghanistan.The applicant must possess a valid Afghan National ID or Passport.The applicant must be between 18 to 35 years of age as on July 1 of the academic year.The applicant must meet the minimum academic qualifications required by the respective Indian university for the chosen program.The applicant must ensure proficiency in English to understand and complete the program, as the medium of instruction is English.The applicant must apply only for one program under the e-VB project.The applicant must not be enrolled in any other ongoing program under the e-VB project.Note:Applicants must check the eligibility criteria/pre-requisites for admission to a particular programme/course on the respective university portal and then apply.Students who have already obtained a degree under e-VB project (at the time of announcement of the new academic session) and willing to avail scholarship under e-VB project for pursuing another degree, may also apply afresh through iLearn portal to process their application
Application_Process: OnlineRegistration of Learners at iLearn Portal:Step 1: Visit iLearn portal and Click "Login/Register".Step 2: On the sign-up page, click on "Sign Up Now". Enter Email ID and click "Send Verification Code".Step 3: Enter Verification Code sent to your mail ID and enter - New Password & Confirm New Password & Display Name & click "CREATE".Step 4: Enter details like First Name, Last Name, Mobile Number, Country residing in currently and Learning Center and click on "I'M NOT A ROBOT", then Click "Register". New User ID will be created for that particular Name and ID.Selection of Programme and Universities:Step 1: Upon Login, students can explore programs based on degree type and category by clicking on "Explore Programmes".Step 2: Click on Browse more to get the More filters like- Course Duration, Course Exam Date, Course Term and Partner Institutions.Submission of Enrolment form at University/HEI Portal:Step 1: Click on the course to select the particular university and the particular course where the page will be directed to the respective university's Signup/ Registration page.Step 2: Click on "Click here for new Registration" to sign up. Enter the email ID and captcha and click on "Verify"Step 3: Once verified click on Sign In and enter the below details and click on "Login".Step 4: Once Login Student will be redirected into University Application forms.Step 5: Fill in all the tabs with required details and clock on submit to complete the enrollment form submission.ICCR e-VB Alumni:Student should fill up the Alumni Form available on iLearn portal ICCR as well as on India Alumni portal after completing the course and before award of final degree. This will help alumni of e-VB to be in touch for future eVB activities and will also be helpful in future for Indian Missions/Posts abroad. to remain engaged with the Alumni.Contact Us:  support@ilearn.gov.in
Documents_Required: Valid academic records/ transcripts/ certificates, as required by the respective Indian University/Institute.Valid National ID with photograph and Date of Birth (The National ID must have validity till the last date of enrolment).Note: The format of scanned documents should be in .jpeg/.jpg/.png format and size should be between 50KB to 250 KB.In case of documents available in local language, applicants are requested to upload certified copies of translations of these documents in English.
Search_Keywords: Awarding Teleeducation Scholarships To Afghan Students, atestas, Afghanistan, E-Learning, Education, Higher Studies, Scholarship, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Pre-Examination Coaching Scheme
Details: The scheme "Pre-Examination Coaching" was introduced by the Tribal Welfare Department, Uttarakhand Government. The scheme aims to enhance employment opportunities for Scheduled Tribe (ST) students by preparing them for competitive examinations. Under this scheme, free coaching and monthly scholarships are provided to eligible Scheduled Tribe students appearing for exams like IAS, PCS, engineering, medical, NDA, Group 'C' exams and other competitive examinations. The scheme is implemented by the government, non-government, and private institutions approved by the state.
Benefits: Free Coaching:Provided for competitive exams such as IAS, PCS, Engineering, Medical, Nursing, NDA, Group 'C', and others.Monthly Scholarship:Rs1,500/- per month for external (non-local) students.Rs750/- per month for local students.
Eligibility: The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Tribe community.The applicant should be a student. The applicant should be preparing for competitive examinations such as IAS, PCS, Engineering, Medical, Nursing, NDA, or Group 'C' exams.The applicant should have passed High School, Intermediate, or Graduation.
Application_Process: OfflineApplication Process for the Student:Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the office of the Tribal Welfare Department and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required).Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the office of the Tribal Welfare Department.Notes: Applications for the selection of coaching institutes are invited through newspapers, and institutes are selected after approval at the government level.Applications are also received from students, and preference for selection in coaching is given based on the marks obtained in high school, intermediate, or graduation.
Documents_Required: Identity ProofCaste CertificateEducational Qualification certificatesBank account detailsAny Other Document if Required

Scheme_Name: Rani Lakshmi Bai Atma Raksha Prashikshan Yojana
Details: Under the "Rani Lakshmi Bai Atma Raksha Prashikshan Yojana", girl students enrolled in government upper primary and secondary schools are provided training in self-defense techniques. This includes training in martial arts disciplines like judo, karate, taekwondo, and boxing. The scheme aims to empower female students by building their confidence, ensuring their safety, and making them physically capable of handling difficult situations. The training is conducted free of cost in selected schools throughout the state.
Benefits: Free Training: Provides vital self-defense skills and training like Judo, Karate, Martial Arts, and Boxing to help girls protect themselves in various situations.
Eligibility: The applicant must be a female.The applicant must be a student.The applicant must be studying in a government upper primary or secondary school in Uttarakhand.
Application_Process: OfflineStep 1: Students are automatically considered in the selected schools.Step 2: No separate application is required by students or parents.Step 3: Schools coordinate with state training agencies to organize sessions.Address and Contact Details:Madhyamik Shiksha Vibhag (Samagra Shiksha) - Rajya Pariyojna, Nanurkheda,Tapovan Marg, Nanurkheda, Raipur, Dehradun.Phone No.: 035-278941, 2781992Helpline No.: 1800-180-4132Email: a spd-ssa-uk@nic.in
Documents_Required: School ID card or admission proof.Birth Certificate.Any other documents as required.

Scheme_Name: Natural Death Assistance for the Construction Workers (UKBOCWWB)
Details: "Natural Death Assistance for the Construction Workers'' is a social security scheme implemented by the Uttarakhand Bhavan and other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Government of Uttarakhand. Under this scheme, financial assistance of Rs2,00,000/- is provided to the nominee or dependent of a deceased registered construction worker in the event of their natural death.
Benefits: Financial assistance of Rs2,00,000/- will be provided in the event of the natural death.Financial assistance of Rs4,00,000/- will be provided in the event of the accidental death.
Eligibility: The deceased worker should have been registered under the Uttarakhand Bhavan and other Construction Workers Welfare Board.The deceased worker should have has lost his/her life due to natural death.The applicant should be the nominee or dependent of a deceased registered construction worker.
Application_Process: Online - via CSCsFor New Registration under the UKBOCWWB:Step 1: To become a beneficiary, a construction worker who has completed 18 years of age and has not completed 60 years, has worked as a construction worker for at least 90 days during the preceding 1 year, can register himself/herself.Step 2: The eligible worker may visit the nearest Jan Seva Kendra or Shramik Suvidha Kendra along with all the relevant documents for online registration.Step 3: Upon successful registration, the applicant will receive a Registration Number for future reference.Step 4: The applicant can also track the status of their application online by visiting the official website: https://ukbocw.uk.gov.in/DynamicPages/LabourSearch-hi.aspxNote 1: After verification of the application, the photo identity card will be issued by the registration officer.Note 2: Registration will be done free of cost, which will be valid for three years and after the completion of three years, only Rs100/- contribution will be required to be deposited by the construction worker for every next three years.Application Process for Welfare Scheme Benefits:Step 1: To avail the benefits of the scheme, the eligible applicant may visit the nearest Shram Suvidha Kendra along with all the relevant documents.Step 2: Upon successful submission of the application form, the applicant will receive an Application Number for future reference.Step 3: The applicant can also track the status of their application online by visiting the official website: https://ukbocw.uk.gov.in/DynamicPages/LabourSchemeSearch.aspx
Documents_Required: For New/Renewal Labour Card:Passport Photocopies (2)Birth Proof (10th Certificate/Birth Certificate/Certificate from a Medical Officer/Notary Certified Self Declaration of the construction worker/Voter ID/Ration Card/Certificate issued by the Panchayat Officer, Gram Pradhan or counsellor.A certificate of employment as a construction worker for at least 90 days in the previous year.A nomination form by the construction worker for the nomination of his legal heirs.Aadhaar card,Ration card,Bank account with Aadhaar linked/seeded,Self-certification/self-declaration form (which can be obtained at Jan Suvidha Kendra or Shramik Suvidha Kendra only)Dependent's Aadhaar card.For Scheme Application:Letter of Application,Death certificate of the deceased worker,Labour Card,Bank account details,Self-declaration certificate,Handwritten certificate stating that they have not received any assistance in this regard and no application has been made in any other department.
Search_Keywords: Natural Death Assistance for the Construction Workers (UKBOCWWB), ndafcwu, Construction Workers, Insurance, Labour, Natural Death Assistance, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Contract Khel Prashikshakon Ki Niyukti
Details: The scheme "Contract Khel Prashikshakon Ki Niyukti" implemented by the Department Of Sports, Uttarakhand, aims to appoint contract-based sports coaches to conduct local training camps for various sports across the state, benefiting approximately 250 coaches annually with employment. Coaches aged 21-70 years, with relevant qualifications, can apply, and permanent residency is not mandatory.
Benefits: Employment Opportunity: Provides annual employment to approximately 250 sports coaches on a contract basis.Promotion of Sports: Facilitates the organization of local training camps for various sports, contributing to sports development.Skill Utilization: Offers a platform for qualified individuals with sports expertise to contribute to athlete development.
Eligibility: The applicant must be a sportsperson or a coach.The applicant must be between 21 -70 years of age.The applicant must possess relevant educational qualifications.The applicant must possess relevant sports qualifications.Note: The applicant is not required to be a permanent/native resident of the state.
Application_Process: OfflineAdvertisement: An advertisement for the Yojana is likely issued annually around March, typically through daily newspapers.Application Submission: Interested candidates should apply based on the guidelines and deadlines mentioned in the advertisement.Selection: Applications are submitted to the District Sports Officers, who evaluate and forward eligible candidates.Appointment: Coaches are selected on a contractual basis to conduct training camps.
Documents_Required: Proof of Age (e.g., birth certificate, matriculation certificate).Educational Qualification Certificates.Sports Qualification Certificates (e.g., coaching certifications, participation certificates).Identity Proof (e.g., Aadhaar Card).Address Proof.Passport-size photographs.Any other documents as required.
Search_Keywords: Contract Khel Prashikshakon Ki Niyukti, ckpkn, Coach Appointment, Employment, Sports, Sports Trainer, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Free Coaching Scheme
Ministry: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
Details: Launched in 2021-22, the scheme "Free Coaching" by the Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment, Government of India aims to provide good coaching quality for De-Notified, Nomadic and Semi-Nomadic (DNT) candidates to enable them to appear in competitive examinations and succeed in obtaining an appropriate job in Public/Private Sector. Through this scheme, free coaching for various competitive examinations with specified maximum fee limits and minimum durations, monthly stipends, and special allowances (for students with disabilities) are provided to the DNT candidates. A minimum physical coaching of 16 hours per week is mandatory for all courses. The scheme is implemented by the Development and Welfare Board for De-Notified, Nomadic and Semi-Nomadic Communities (DWBDNC). The DWBDNC selects a total of 1,250 students each year, allowing them the liberty to pursue coaching in any institute of their choice.Objectives:To provide good coaching quality for DNT candidates to enable them to appear in competitive examinations.To enable DNT candidates to succeed in obtaining an appropriate job in the Public/Private Sector.
Benefits: 1. Coaching Fees: The actual course fee of the institute in which the student is applying, which the institute charges from general students, or the prescribed course fee by the Ministry as per the Annexure of the Scheme, whichever is less. This is subject to the limits for fees and duration of the course. The maximum total course fee for various courses is as follows:S. No.CoursesMax. Total Course Fee in RupeesMin. Duration in months1Civil Services Exam by UPSC/SPSCs Rs1,20,000/-9 months (4 months prelim + 5 months mains)2SSC/RRB Rs40,000/-6 months3Banking /Insurance/ PSU/ CLATRs50,000/-6 months4JEE/NEETRs1,20,000/-9 months (not exceeding 12 months)5IESRs80,000/--do-6CAT /CMATRs60,000/--do-7GRE/GMAT/SAT/TOFELRs35,000/-3 months8CA-CPT/ GATERs75,000/-9 months9CPL CoursesRs30,000/-6 months10NDA/CDSRs20,000/-3 months*A minimum physical coaching of 16 hours per week is mandatory for all the above courses.*If the course fee is more than the admissible amount, the candidate has to arrange for the remaining funds from his/her own sources.2. Stipend: A monthly stipend is provided for attending coaching classes.For local students: Rs1,500/- per month.For outstation students: Rs3,000/- per month.The stipend will be paid for the duration of the course or for one year, whichever is less.3. Special Allowance: Students with disabilities (having a valid disability certificate of 40% or more disability) are eligible for a Special Allowance of Rs2,000 per month. This allowance is towards reader allowance, escort allowance, helper allowance, etc., and is in addition to the regular stipend.4. Courses for Coaching: The coaching will be imparted for the following courses, with specified minimum durations:Group A and B examinations are conducted by the Union Public Service Commission (UPSC), the Staff Selection Commission (SSC) and the various Railway Recruitment Boards (RRBs).Group A and B examinations are conducted by the State Public Service Commissions (SPSCs).Officers' Grade examinations conducted by Banks, Insurance Companies and Public Sector Undertakings (PSUs).Premier Entrance Examinations for admission in (a) Engineering (e.g., IIT-JEE), (b) Medical (e.g., NEET), (c) Professional courses like Management (e.g., CAT, CMAT) and Law (e.g., CLAT), and (d) Any other such disciplines as the Ministry may decide from time to time.Eligibility tests/examinations like SAT, GRE, GMAT and TOEFL.Entrance examination tests for Commercial Pilot License (CPL) courses/ National Defence Academy (NDA), and Combined Defence Services (CDS).Indian Engineering Services (IES).Chartered Accountant - Common Proficiency Test (CA-CPT)/Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE).5. Number of Benefits: The benefits under the Scheme can be availed by a particular student not more than twice, irrespective of the number of chances he/she may be entitled to take in a particular competitive examination.6. Coaching for Multi-Stage Examinations: Where the competitive examination is conducted in two stages, namely Preliminary and Mains, the candidates will be entitled to free coaching for both examinations. They will be entitled to free coaching up to two times each for Preliminary and Main examinations as per their convenience. However, there will be no restriction on the number of chances for coaching for the Interview if the candidate is selected for the interview.7. Distribution of Slots: Of the total selected students, 40% shall be earmarked for competitive exams having eligibility condition as Class 12 (e.g., NEET, JEE, CLAT etc.). The remaining 60% students shall be for competitive exams having eligibility condition as Graduation (e.g., CAT, Civil Services Examination, etc.).Mode of Disbursement:Coaching Fees: The course fee shall be released directly into the Aadhaar-linked bank account of the beneficiary candidate in two installments through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) mode.The first instalment of 50% of the eligible amount will be released immediately after the candidate uploads the admission confirmation/assurance from the coaching institute on the online portal.The remaining fee will be reimbursed after receiving proof of joining the institute by the candidate and deposition of the amount released as the first instalment by the candidate to the institute.Stipend: The stipend to each student shall be paid directly by the Ministry through DBT.Special Allowance: The special allowance will be paid directly by the Ministry through DBT along with the stipend.Expected Time of Disbursement:First Installment of Fees: Immediately after the candidate uploads the admission confirmation/assurance from the institute on the online portal.Second Installment of Fees: After receiving proof of joining the institute and the deposition of the first installment by the candidate to the institute.Stipend and Special Allowance: Monthly, till the duration of the course or for one year, whichever is less.Validity:The candidate will be required to join the selected course within 6 months of the release of the first installment of the fee. If the first installment of the fee amount is not paid to the selected institute within a period of 6 months, this amount will have to be returned to the Government and the second installment will not be eligible.
Eligibility: The applicant must belong to De-Notified, Nomadic and Semi-Nomadic (DNT) communities.The applicant's total family income from all sources should be Rs2,50,000/- or less per annum.The applicant should not be availing of any such benefits from a similar scheme of the Central Government or the State Government.The applicant must have secured the minimum marks in the qualifying examination of the competitive exam for which coaching is sought, as prescribed in the guidelines of the said competitive exam.If the applicant has not yet appeared for the qualifying examination, or if the result has not been declared, the marks obtained in the Board/Degree exam just prior to the qualifying exam shall be taken into account.For competitive exams where the qualifying exam is Class 12th, the applicant must have passed Class 12th or be studying in Class 12th as on the date of receiving the benefit under the scheme.For competitive exams where the qualifying exam is at the bachelor's level, the applicant must have completed the bachelor's level course or be studying in the final year of the bachelor's degree course at the time of receiving the benefits under the scheme.The applicant will be required to submit an affidavit that he/she has not taken benefit more than twice under the Scheme.The applicant is required to join an institute as empanelled by the Ministry under the "Free Coaching Scheme for Scheduled Caste (SC) and Other Backward Class (OBC) students."A minimum physical coaching of 16 hours per week will be mandatory for all the courses.Preference/Priority:For such examinations, which are conducted in two parts, Preliminary and Mains, priority in the selection will be given to those students who have at least once qualified for the preliminary examination.If the number of eligible applications received is more than the given slots, the selection will be done in decreasing order of the marks obtained in the qualifying exams.
Application_Process: OnlineStep-by-Step Online Registration Process:Step 1: Navigate to the official Website:Visit to the Official Website of the Development and Welfare Board for De-notified, Nomadic, and Semi-Nomadic Communities (DWBDNC). Step 2: Access the Registration Page:You would first need to navigate to the "Registration" home page of the portal and select "Free Coaching Registration".Step 3: Fill in Basic Details:Enter your First Name, Guardian Name, Mobile Number, Email Address, Date of Birth, and your Aadhaar Number.Select your Gender and your Marital Status from the dropdown.Step 4: Create Password:Enter your desired Password. The password must meet the criteria: at least one UPPERCASE letter, one lowercase letter, one number (0-9), and one special character (!@#$%^&*()?).Re-enter the same password in the Confirm Password field to ensure it matches.Step 5: Provide Address Details:Select your State from the provided dropdown list (e.g., Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Andhra Pradesh, Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Bihar, etc., covering all Indian States and Union Territories).Select your District from the dropdown list (this will likely populate after you select your State).Enter your Village and Pincode.Step 6: Provide Social Identification:Select your Social Category from the dropdown: DNT, NT, or SNT.Select your Community from the dropdown (this will likely populate after you select your Social Category).Enter your Caste.Step 7: Upload Documents:Upload your ID Proof (PDF/image file, up to 200KB).Upload your Caste Certificate/Document (PDF/image file, up to 200KB).Upload your DNT Certificate (PDF/image file, up to 200KB).Note: For DNT applicants without a separate DNT certificate, a caste certificate is acceptable.Upload your Self Photo (PDF/image file, up to 200KB).Step 8: Review and Declare:Carefully review all the information you have furnished to ensure it is true, complete, and correct.Read the declaration statement: "I hereby declare that the information furnished above is true, complete and correct to the best of my knowledge and belief. I understand that in the event of my information being found false or incorrect at any stage, my application shall be liable to cancellation/termination without notice or any compensation in lieu thereof."Acknowledge the notes:"Registration does not guarantee scheme benefits; eligibility will be verified.""For DNT applicants without a separate certificate, a caste certificate is acceptable."Step 9: Submit Registration:Click the "Register" button to finalise and submit your registration.Step-by-Step Login Process:Step 1: Navigate to the official Website:Visit to the Official Website of the Development and Welfare Board for De-notified, Nomadic, and Semi-Nomadic Communities (DWBDNC). Step 2: Access the Login Page:You would first need to navigate to the "Login home page of the portal.Step 3: Enter User ID: In the field labelled "User ID / Email ID / Mobile," enter your registered User ID, Email ID, or Mobile Number that you used during the registration process.Step 4: Enter Password: In the field labelled "Password," enter the password you created during registration.Type these characters exactly as they appear into the "Enter Captcha" field. If the captcha is unclear, click the refresh icon next to it to get a new one.Step 5: Click Login: Once all fields are filled correctly, click the blue "Login" button.Notes: The scheme will be widely advertised through electronic media etc. giving summarized information about the Scheme. The applicants shall, after assessing their eligibility and suitability as per the eligibility conditions of the Scheme, will be required to apply online on this Ministry's portal, i.e. coaching.dosje.gov.in, along with details of course he/she intends to join.The portal will remain open for one month twice a year i.e. during the month of July and January for receiving applications.No offline applications will be entertained. Only online applications complete in all respects, shall be considered for assistance. All the incomplete applications will be summarily rejected. However, the rejected candidates will have the option to apply in the subsequent phases of selection.
Documents_Required: Family Income Certificate.10th Marksheet Certificate.12th Marksheet Certificate.Disability Certificate (if applicable).Admission Confirmation/Assurance from Coaching Institute. Proof of Joining the Institute.Proof of Deposition of First Installment to the Institute.
Search_Keywords: Free Coaching Scheme, freecoach, Coaching, Competitive Exams, DNT, Special Allowance, Stipend, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Dr. Bhimrao Ambedkar Sanskrit Scholarship Scheme for Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe Students
Details: The "Dr. Bhimrao Ambedkar Sanskrit Scholarship Scheme for Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe Students" implemented by the Department of Sanskrit Education, Uttarakhand, supports Scheduled Caste (SC) and Scheduled Tribe (ST) students studying in Sanskrit schools and colleges in Uttarakhand. The scheme encourages the continuation of Sanskrit education by providing a monthly scholarship of Rs251/- (Rs3,012/- annually) to eligible students from Classes 6 to 12. It aims to uplift students from marginalized communities by ensuring their active participation in traditional and cultural education.
Benefits: Scholarship Amount: Monthly Rs251/- (Rs3,012/- annually) to eligible students.
Eligibility: The applicant must be a Student.The applicant must be studying in a Sanskrit school or college located in Uttarakhand.The applicant must be enrolled in Class 6 to Class 12.The applicant must belong to a Scheduled Caste (SC) or Scheduled Tribe (ST) category.The applicant must possess a valid caste certificate issued by a competent authority.
Application_Process: OfflineStep 1: Eligible students enrolled in Class 6 to 12 must gather required documents such as Caste Certificate, Aadhaar Card, Bank Account details.Step 2: Submit all documents to the school/college principal.Step 3: The principal forwards applications to the Assistant Director of Sanskrit Education, Uttarakhand.Step 4: The Assistant Director reviews and sends applications to the concerned Director for approval and disbursal.Address and Contact Details:Sanskrit Shiksha VibhagUttarakhand Sanskrit Academy, Haridwar - Sanskrit Bhavanam, Ranipuhjalam, Jwalapur, HaridwaramPhone: 983749064E-mail: uksa 2002@qmail.comUttarakhand Sanskrit Vishwavidyalaya, Haridwar - Bahadrabad, Haridwar, Delhi Rashtriya Rajmarg, P.O. Bahadrabad, HaridwarPhone: 035-2665054E-mail: registrar@usw.ac.in, ssnuk2011@gmail.com
Documents_Required: Caste Certificate (Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe).Aadhaar Card.Bank Account details.Any other documents as required.

Scheme_Name: Pandit Dindayal Upadhyay Awas Yojana (Developing Caste Welfare) (EBC)
Details: The scheme "Pandit Dindayal Upadhyay Awas Yojana (Developing Caste Welfare) (EBC)" is a housing scheme by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to support Economically Weaker Sections (EWS) by offering financial aid up to Rs1,20,000/- for house construction. This scheme also ensures that the Economically Weaker Sections receive support in securing shelter.
Benefits: Financial Assistance of up to Rs1,20,000/- for house construction.
Eligibility: Applicant must belong to the Economically Backward Class (EBC).Applicant must be a resident of Gujarat.Applicant's family income should not exceed Rs6,00,000/- per annum.Applicant must own land or have been allotted land/house under a government poverty housing scheme.
Application_Process: OnlineRegistrationStep 1: Visit the Official Website of eSamajkalyan.Step 2: In the right pane of the home page, click "New User? Please Register Here!".You will be taken to the Registration Form.Step 3: In the form, provide all the mandatory fields, fill in the captcha code, and click "Submit" to complete the registration process. A popup will appear acknowledging successful registration and displaying your User ID for Login.ApplicationStep 1: Visit the Official Website of eSamajkalyan.Step 2: In the "Citizen Login" section provided in the right pane of the home page, provide your User ID and Password, fill in the Captcha Code, then click "Login".Step 3: In the ribbon provided at the top of the website, click the "Corporation" menu, then click on "Pandit Dindayal Upadhyay Awas Yojana (Developing Caste Welfare) (EBC)".Step 4: You will be taken to the online application form of the scheme. In the form, provide all the mandatory fields and upload all the mandatory documents in the specified format and size.Step 5: Carefully review all the information provided and the documents uploaded. Make corrections, if any.Step 6: Click "Submit" to submit your application. You'll receive a confirmation message. Note down your Application Number for future reference. You can also take a printout of the submitted application form.Track Application StatusStep 1: Visit the Official Website of eSamajkalyan.Step 2: Navigate to the bottom of the home page, and click "Your Application Status".Step 3: In the next page, provide your Application Number, Date of Birth, and click "View Status". The current status of your application will be displayed.
Documents_Required: Aadhaar Card.Bank Passbook/Cancelled Cheque.Caste Certificate.Income Certificate.Land Ownership Aadhaar.Land Ownership Acknowledgment Form.Title Deed/Sanad Deed (as applicable).Map of land signed by Talati-cum-Mantri.Allotment order of land/house (if received under a poverty scheme).Permission letter for building construction.Certificate from the Circle Inspector for housing assistance.Certificate from City or Gram Panchayat Talati-cum-Mantri.

Scheme_Name: Niramaya Health Insurance Scheme
Ministry: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
Details: "Niramaya Health Insurance Scheme" was launched by the Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities, Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment. Government of India. The objective of the scheme is to provide affordable Health Insurance to persons with Autism, Cerebral Palsy, Mental Retardation and Multiple Disabilities. The scheme provides insurance coverage of up to Rs1,00,000/-, which must be renewed annually after the financial year.
Benefits: Health insurance coverage: Up to Rs1,00,000/- for various expenses.Outpatient department (OPD) treatment: Covers medicines, pathology, diagnostic tests, etc.Regular medical checkups: For non-ailing individuals with disabilities.Dental care: Preventive dentistry services.Surgery: To prevent further disability worsening or for existing disabilities (including congenital).Non-surgical/hospitalization: Coverage for non-surgical treatments and related stays.Ongoing therapies: For managing disability and related complications.Alternative medicine: Coverage for alternative treatment options.Health insurance coverage: Up to Rs1,00,000/- bifurcation for various expenses.Section I: Hospitalization :  The overall limit for hospitalization expenses is Rs55,000/-. This includes:Corrective Surgeries for existing Disability including congenital disability (Under SECI(A)a maximum capping of Rs15,000/- For other than the corrective surgeries for Existing Disabilities, which is include in the overall limit of Rs40,000/- of Sec I(A))Non-surgical or hospitalization costs are covered up to Rs15,000/-.Section II: Outpatient Department (OPD) : The overall OPD treatment limit is Rs19,000/-, broken down as:OPD treatment, including medicines, pathology, diagnostic tests, etc., is covered up to Rs15,000/-.Dental preventive dentistry is covered up to Rs4,000/-.Section III: Ongoing TherapiesA total of Rs20,000/- is allocated for ongoing therapies aimed at reducing the impact of disability.Section IV: Alternative Medicine (AYUSH)Treatment under AYUSH systems of medicine is reimbursable up to Rs4,000/-.Section V: TransportationTransportation costs related to medical treatment are covered up to Rs2,000/-.
Eligibility: All the disable person who have at least one of the disabilities under the National Trust Act, 1999 with valid disability certificate.
Application_Process: OnlineOfflineEnrolment process:Step 1: Parents/ guardian of the PwD will visit the nearest Registered Organization (RO) for Niramaya enrolment with required documents.Step 2: RO will fill up the Niramaya application form online and upload the scanned documents as required after verification of the originals. Step 3: On successful enrolment and approval, Health ID No. /card will be issued to each beneficiary or can be downloaded by the beneficiary online or through RO.Scheme Renewal process:Step 1: The parent/guardian of the beneficiary can renew the scheme with the required documents online by logging on to the Niramaya website through providing below details: Policy Period, Beneficiary ID, UDID No/Enrollment no, Date of birth.Step 2: RO to verify the validity of documents Step 3: Pay the application fees online.Step 4: After receipt of payment, the RO/beneficiary will be notified of the renewal for another year through the website.Scheme Claim Process:All claims for settlement under Niramaya have to be submitted to the canters of the insurance provider in the prescribed Claim Form along with relevant vouchers/bills, etc. (preferably within 30 days of treatment) or discharge from hospital.Step 1: Log on to https://portal.mediassist.in - MediAssist Employee portal. (Your username will be as <application_id>@NATIONALTRUST.Com and password will be your date of Birth of Beneficiary e.g. DD-MM-YYYY)* You can also download the Mediassist App from Android/Apple/Window store in a phone [Username - <application_id>@NATIONALTRUST.Com and password will be DD-MM-YYYY (Date of Birth of the Beneficiary]Step 2: Click on Submit claim option and fill the details to generate the claim form.Step 3: Click on "Save and Next" once all the details are filled.On 3rd Page, employee KYC documents are to be updated (one time activity).Step 4: Upload relevant documents. Step 5: After Moving to the final Page "Declaration and Claim Submission"  select the ailment type.Step 6: Upload the softcopy of the documents.Step 7: Acknowledge the declaration and Click submit to successfully generate the claim form.Step 8: An Auto-generated mail will be triggered to your registered Email ID containing the claim form.Dedicated helpline for claims : 040-68178569/71326135.To register or track your Claim, please contact MediAssist at:Phone: 040-68213648   |   Toll Free - 1800 572 9792For any query regarding reimbursement of claim, email to MediAssist TPA on - niramaya[at]mediassist[dot]in
Documents_Required: Enrollment Process:For BPL (Enrolment Fee - Rs250/-)Disability certificate (Self attested) issued from the District Hospital or appropriate Government authority BPL cardAddress ProofProof of payment.For APL (if family income up to Rs 15,000/- Per Month) (Enrolment Fee - Rs250/-)Disability certificate issued from the DistrictHospital or appropriate Government authority (Self attested)Address ProofProof of paymentIncome certificate of (Self attested) the parent/ guardian competent authority as issued by the State.For APL (if family income above Rs15,000/- Per Month) (Enrolment Fee - Rs550/-)Disability certificate (Self attested) issuedby the competent authority as issued by theStateAddress ProofProof of payment.For Renewal: For BPL:BPL card.Address Proof (in case of change of address).For APL (if family income up to Rs 15,000/- Per Month) (Renewal Fee - Rs250/-)Address Proof (in case of change of address)Income certificate (self attested) of the parent/ guardian competent authority as issued by the StateProof of payment.For APL (if family income above Rs15,000/- Per Month) (Renewal Fee - Rs500/-)Proof of paymentAddress proof (in case of change of address).For Claim Process:Copy of Niramaya card or mention Health ID Card number.Self-attested copy of Disability Certificate.All original prescription papers given by the doctor.All original bills of Hospital / Medicine / Doctor fee / Therapy fee / Conveyance etc.All reports in original.Complete bank details of Beneficiary : Name of Account Holder.Account No. / Bank Name / Branch / (City & State).Bank account IFSC Code.Note:Need for ORIGINAL REPORTS / FILMS LIKE MRI, X-RAY, ULTRASOUNDS ETC.: Original documents are required including the film for settling of Claims.Prescription for Ongoing Therapies: Doctor's prescription at least once in Six months is essential in which the category of therapy and duration of therapy should be clearly mentioned. Thereafter other documents from Rehabilitation Professional for therapy, and related bills will be acceptable. Doctor who prescribes the prescription should be a valid medical Practitioner with valid license/degree as per Medical council rules.

Scheme_Name: Sugamya Pustakalaya
Details: The scheme "Sugamya Pustakalaya"  implemented by the National Institute for the Empowerment of Persons with Visual Disabilities (NIEPVD), Dehradun,  aims to make educational, literary, and informative content accessible to persons with visual and print disabilities across the country. Through this scheme, a wide range of content, including braille books, audiobooks, e-books, and accessible digital materials, is provided through an online library platform. The scheme is implemented by the National Institute for Empowerment of Persons with Visual Disabilities (NIEPVD) in collaboration with DAISY Forum of India and other content partners.
Benefits: Wide Range of Accessible Formats: Access to over 5,000 titles, including braille books, audiobooks, e-books, and accessible formats in multiple Indian languages, to cater to different needs of visually impaired and print-disabled individuals.Free Membership: Individual membership is free for persons with visual or print disabilities.Institutional Collaboration: Institutional membership for organizations is available at an annual fee of Rs2,000/- or for 3 years at Rs5,000/-.
Eligibility: For Individual Membership:The applicant should be a person with visual impairment or print disability.The applicant should possess a valid disability certificate.For Institutional Membership:The applicant should be a recognized organization or institution working for or with persons with disabilities.
Application_Process: OnlineIndividual (End User) Registration:Step 1: Visit the offiicial portal of Sugamya Pustakalaya.Step 2: Click "Register as End User".Step 3: Provide the required information. Make sure all the information you submit here is correct and complete. Choose the library to which you want to send your membership application.Step 4: Your membership request will be sent to the DFI member organization you selected.Step 5: You will be intimated by email/SMS when your membership request is approved by the DFI member library. You will then be able to log in, search and download books.Registration Process for Organization, Library, School, and University:Step 1: First, such organizations need to become a member of DAISY Forum of India. For more information see: www.daisyindia.org.Step 2: Then visit the official portal of Sugamya Pustakalaya.Step 3: Click Register now. Click Register as Library.Step 4: Provide the required information. Make sure all the information you submit here is correct and complete since it will be visible to the public. In particular provide a good description of your organization in not more than 300 words.Step 5: Provide the logo of your organization in a jpg file of less than 1 MB size.Step 6: You will need to provide contact details of the key person (in-charge of library) in the next step.Step 7: On completion of the registration process, you will receive an email with login id and temporary password.Step 8: Your membership request will be sent to DFI who will approve it. You will get intimation by email when your membership is approved.Step 9: After this you should login to the website. You will be prompted to change password.Step 10: Your account will be designated the Super admin status. You will be able to create other roles for your library.Contact On:Sugamya PustakalayaC/O: The DAISY Forum of India486 Double Storey, New Rajinder NagarNew Delhi - 110 060, IndiaPhone: 1800 300 20469 (Toll free) or +91-11-42411015Email : info@daisyindia.org
Documents_Required: For Individual Membership:Proof of visual disability or print disability (e.g., Disability Certificate, Doctor's Certificate).Unique Disability ID (UDID) Card.Aadhaar card.For Institutional Membership:Application for library membership on institutional letterhead by the competent authority.Certificate of the institution under the Registered Societies Act.
Search_Keywords: Sugamya Pustakalaya, spuku, Audiobook, Braille Books, Digital Library, Learning, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Deendayal Upadhay Sahkarita Kisan Kalyan Yojana
Details: The scheme "Deendayal Upadhyay Sahakarita Kisan Kalyan Yojana" by the Cooperative Societies, Uttarakhand Government, aims to provide economic facilities to farmers, aiming to double their agricultural production income, and to make the loan distribution scheme beneficial under the state government's plan to double farmers' income. It also seeks to check migration from rural areas, create employment opportunities, and provide self-employment opportunities to farmers to improve their livelihoods.  The scheme is implemented by Cooperative Societies, District Cooperative Banks, and State Cooperative Banks.
Benefits: Interest-free loan up to Rs1,00,000/- for agricultural activities for individuals.Interest-free loan up to Rs3,00,000/- for non-agricultural activities for individuals. These activities include, but are not limited to, animal husbandry, medicinal plant production, aromatic plants, spice production, dairy business, fisheries, poultry, mushroom production, flower production, horticulture, agricultural processing, agricultural mechanization, organic farming, off-season vegetable production, and poly-house.Interest-free loan up to Rs5,00,000/- for Self-Help Groups.Interest Rate Structure (for loans disbursed from the date of the order):No.Interest RateFrom the Government of India (for timely repayment)Financial Burden Borne by State Government (for timely repayment)To be borne by Farmers (for timely repayment)1Short-term loan up to Rs1,00,000/-  7%3%4%Zero2Medium-term loan up to Rs1,60,000/-11%Zero11%ZeroMedium-term loan above Rs1,60,000/-up to Rs3,00,000/-11%Zero9%Zero3Loan to Self-Help Groups up to Rs5,00,000/-11%Zero11%ZeroNote: For medium-term loans exceeding Rs1,60,000/- under Deendayal Upadhyay Sahakarita Kisan Kalyan Yojana (DDU SKKY), disbursed through cooperative bank branches, the interest rate between the bank and the member will be 9.00%.Conditions/Aspects/Criteria Associated with Benefits:The reimbursement of the difference between the normal interest rate and the scheme's interest rate will be made by NABARD and the Uttarakhand Government.This facility (interest subsidy) is to be provided only to those farmers who have repaid their loans in a timely manner.Mode of Disbursement:The interest subsidy will be transferred to the accounts of farmers and Self-Help Groups.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a general, small, marginal, or Below Poverty Line (BPL) farmer.The applicant should be a member of the farmer's family.The applicant can be a Self-Help Group (SHG).The applicant's status as a small, marginal, or BPL farmer will be determined based on certificates or criteria issued by agencies determined or declared by the state government.
Application_Process: OfflineThe application will be submitted by the applicant at the cooperative societies or a bank branch.Note: Thereafter, beneficiaries will be selected by the Block Level Committee.Selected applicants shall be provided loan through the concerned Primary Agricultural Credit Society (PACS) or District Cooperative Bank (DCB) Branch.
Documents_Required: Certificate/Criteria from State Government Determined/Declared Agency (for Small, Marginal, and BPL Farmer Identification).Bank Savings Account Details (in a District Cooperative Bank).Aadhaar Card (for Aadhaar seeding with bank account).Complete Records for 06 Months (for Self-Help Groups).Activity Assessment (for Self-Help Groups).Cash Credit Limit (CCL), Loan Repayment Status, and Utilisation Details (for Self-Help Groups, if previously benefited from CCL).Cash Credit Limit (CCL) Account Transfer Details (for Self-Help Groups, if the CCL account is in a nationalised bank).Utilisation Certificate (after Medium-Term Loan distribution).Insurance Document for Purchased Animals (for medium-term loans).
Search_Keywords: Deendayal Upadhay Sahkarita Kisan Kalyan Yojana, dduskky, Agriculture, BPL, Farmers, Interest Free, Loan, Self Help Groups, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Provision of Special Assistance for Development of Low-Cost Educational Materials (SIPDA)
Details: The scheme "Provision of Special Assistance for Development of Low-Cost Educational Materials (SIPDA)" under the Scheme for Implementation of the Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act, 2016 (SIPDA), aims to financially support the creation and modernization of assistive educational tools for visually impaired students pursuing school and higher education. Through this scheme, implementing agencies receive grants to procure, produce, and enhance the capacity of institutions producing educational aids such as Braille presses and digital books. The scheme is implemented by the National Institute for the Empowerment of Persons with Visual Disabilities (NIEPVD).
Benefits: Support for Braille Presses: Assistance is given for the installation of new Braille presses and enhancement of the capacity and modernization of existing Braille presses.Upgradation of Talking Book Studios: Financial support is offered for increasing the capacity and modernization of existing Talking Book Studios.Creation and Enhancement of Digital Book Production Centers: Grants are available for setting up new Digital Book Production Centers and modernizing existing centers to improve production capabilities.Support for Large Print Book Production: Funding is provided for establishing new Large Print Book Production Centers and increasing the capacity and modernization of existing large print facilities.
Eligibility: Individual Eligibility:The applicant must be a visually impaired student enrolled in school or pursuing higher education.The applicant must have a valid Unique Disability ID (UDID) card issued by the competent authority.Institutional Eligibility:The agency must be approved for SIPDA projects.The agency must be actively involved in the development, production, or distribution of educational materials for persons with visual disabilities.
Application_Process: OfflineFor Institutional Applicants:Step 1: The implementing agency should prepare a project proposal outlining the infrastructure to be established or upgraded.Step 2: The proposal should be submitted to NIEPVD or the concerned state authority for review and approval.Step 3: Once approved, funds are disbursed as per the sanctioned amount.Step 4: The agency must maintain transparency in utilization and submit reports and utilization certificates as required.For Student Beneficiaries (if applicable):Step 1: The student should approach an approved implementing agency.Step 2: Submit necessary documents such as Aadhaar, UDID, and school/college ID.Step 3: The agency will facilitate access to learning materials based on availability and eligibility.Website: niepvd.nic.inTelephone No.: 7579278149
Documents_Required: For Students:Unique Disability ID (UDID)Date of BirthParent/Guardian's Mobile NumberSchool DetailsFor Implementing Agencies:Project Proposal outlining the development and production of education support materials.Relevant Financial Statements (for recurring and non-recurring grant applications).Any other documents as required.

Scheme_Name: S.P. Nautiyal Museum
Details: The scheme "S.P. Nautiyal Sangrahalaya" implemented by the Wadia Institute of Himalayan Geology, offers a deep insight into the Great Himalayas. The museum showcases geo-scientific maps, charts, specimens, models, and various educational and awareness-generating exhibits. Samples of rocks, minerals, and fossils found throughout the Himalayan region are also displayed here. This museum serves as a valuable resource for understanding the geology and natural history of the Himalayas.
Benefits: Educational Insight: Provides in-depth knowledge and understanding of the Great Himalayas through geo-scientific exhibits.Awareness Generation: Raises awareness about the geological and natural heritage of the Himalayan region.Diverse Exhibits: Offers a wide range of exhibits including maps, charts, models, and actual samples of rocks, minerals, and fossils.Accessibility: Open to both national and international visitors, making it a globally accessible resource for Himalayan studies.
Eligibility: The applicant can be any national/ international visitor, or a large group/ an institution seeking a guided tour.
Application_Process: OfflineFor Individuals/Families:If an individual or a family wishes to visit the Wadia Institute of Himalayan Geology Museum, they can visit on any working day (Monday to Friday, from 9:30 AM to 5:30 PM). It is advisable to obtain prior permission by sending an email to rksehgal@wihg.res.in or by calling 0135-2525263 / 118.For Large Groups/Institutional Tours:For guided tours for large groups or institutional visits, it is mandatory to obtain prior permission from the Director of the Institution: director@wihg.res.in
Documents_Required: Proof of Identity.Any other documents as required.
Search_Keywords: S.P. Nautiyal Museum, spnmuk, Educational Exhibits, Visitor, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Motorcycle Taxi Scheme
Details: The scheme "Motorcycle Taxi Scheme" by the Cooperative Department, Uttarakhand Government, aims to create employment and facilitate transportation for tourists and travelers between different locations at major tourist spots in the state. Through this scheme, financial assistance in the form of loans for new motorcycle taxis and an interest subsidy is provided to eligible applicants. The scheme is implemented by the Cooperative Societies of Uttarakhand through the District Cooperative Banks.
Benefits: Improved Connectivity: Enhances last-mile transport in remote and rural areas with limited public transport. Affordable Travel: Provides a low-cost option for short-distance commutes. Job Creation: Offers employment opportunities for youth and entrepreneurs. Entrepreneurship Support: Encourages self-employment through motorcycle taxi services. Eco-Friendly: Prompts fuel-efficient transport, reducing environmental impact. Enhanced Mobility: Ensures faster, convenient travel, especially in congested or poorly connected areas. Boost to Economy: Stimulates local businesses and tourism by providing reliable transport options.A loan for a new scooter or motorcycle is provided, which must be registered as a taxi in Uttarakhand and approved for taxi operation. The loan amount covers the vehicle cost, registration, and insurance fees.The maximum loan sanctioned will be 75% of the motorcycle taxi's purchase price or Rs1,25,000/-, whichever is less.An interest subsidy for the first 2 years will be provided. The current annual interest rate is 10%.The vehicle purchased under the scheme must be of a single uniform color, and its operation is limited only to Uttarakhand state.The vehicle must have comprehensive insurance covering all risks under the Bankers Clause, jointly in the name of the bank (primary beneficiary) and the borrower (secondary beneficiary). All insurance expenses are to be borne by the borrower.Frequency of Disbursement:Loan: This is a one-time disbursement upon approval.Interest Subsidy: The District Cooperative Banks will compile beneficiary-wise interest demands from their branches on a quarterly basis and send them to the State Cooperative Bank and the Registrar's office. Subsequently, the interest subsidy will be received from the state government and deposited into the beneficiaries' accounts.Validity:Loan Tenure: The maximum loan tenure is 3 years. Loan recovery will begin one month after the loan disbursement date, in 35 equal monthly instalments.Interest Subsidy: The interest subsidy is provided for the first 2 years of the loan.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.The applicant's age should be more than 18 years and less than 55 years.The applicant should possess a valid driving license for driving a motorcycle taxi, issued by the Transport Department.The applicant should not be a defaulter of any financial institution or cooperative institution.The applicant's minimum CIBIL (Credit Rating Agency) score should not be less than 700.
Application_Process: OfflineThe applicant should visit the nearest bank to obtain the loan application form in the prescribed format and submit it to the bank's headquarters. Note: After district-level verification, the forms are presented to the district committee for selection. Selected applicants' forms are forwarded to the relevant branches through the district cooperative bank's head office.The branches complete the formalities, issue the loan approval letter, and transfer the loan amount directly to the vendor from whom the motorcycle/Taxi will be purchased.
Documents_Required: Loan Application Form (in prescribed format).Valid Driving License (for motorcycle taxi).Proof of Uttarakhand Permanent Residency.Age Proof.CIBIL Score Report (Credit Rating Agency).Personal Guarantor Documents (details regarding permanent residency within the bank's operational area, sufficient immovable property, and status as respected bank account holders).
Search_Keywords: Motorcycle Taxi Scheme, mtsuk, Loan, Tourist Vehicle, Transportation, Vehicle, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Assistance to Disabled Persons for Purchase/Fitting of Aids and Appliances (NIEPVD Dehradun)
Details: The scheme "Assistance to Disabled Persons for Purchase/Fitting of Aids and Appliances (ADIP)"  implemented by National Institute for Empowerment of Persons with Visual Disabilities (NIEPVD), Dehradun, aims to assist persons with disabilities in enhancing their physical, social, and psychological rehabilitation by providing them with modern, standard aids and appliances. Through this scheme, eligible visually, hearing, locomotor, and mentally disabled individuals receive necessary assistive devices free of cost or at a subsidized rate. The scheme is implemented by the National Institute for the Empowerment of Persons with Visual Disabilities (NIEPVD), Dehradun.
Benefits: For Visually Impaired: Braille Kit, Daisy Player, Refractive Mirror, Mobility Cane, Smart Phone.For Hearing Impaired: Hearing Aid.For Locomotor Disabled: Wheelchair, Tricycle, Walking Sticks, Calipers, Crutches.For Mentally Disabled: MR Kit.Note:For those with an annual income up to Rs22,500/-, the aid is provided completely free.For those with an annual income up to Rs30,000/-, 50% of the cost of the aid must be borne by the beneficiary.
Eligibility: The applicant must be a person with a benchmark disability.The applicant's disability must be certified by a competent medical authority.The applicant's monthly income should not exceed Rs30,000/-.Note:Visually impaired children up to 12 years of age can apply for a Braille kit free of charge every year under the aid scheme.Excluding smartphones, if visually impaired children want to receive other devices again under the aid scheme after receiving them once, they can apply only after a minimum interval of 03 years.After receiving a smartphone once, one can apply again only after 05 years.
Application_Process: OfflineStep 1: The interested applicant should visit the National Institute for the Empowerment of Persons with Visual Disabilities (NIEPVD), Dehradun and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form.Step 2: In the application form, provide all the mandatory details, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required).Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the supporting documents to the National Institute for the Empowerment of Persons with Visual Disabilities (NIEPVD), Dehradun.Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted.Website: niepvd.nic.inTelephone No.:0135-2736651, 2734016Email: tcab-niepvd@nivh.gov.in
Documents_Required: Aadhaar Card.Disability Certificate.Income Certificate of Parent.UDID (Unique Disability ID) Card.Educational Details.
Search_Keywords: Assistance to Disabled Persons for Purchase/Fitting of Aids and Appliances (NIEPVD Dehradun), adppfaa, Assistive Devices, Disability Aids, Free Aids, Hearing Impairment, Visual Impairment, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Shilpi Gram Scheme (Scheduled Caste / Scheduled Tribe)
Details: The "Shilpi Gram Scheme (Scheduled Caste / Scheduled Tribe)" scheme was launched by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to preserve, promote, and develop traditional artisan crafts among Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes in Uttarakhand. Under this scheme, free skill development training, infrastructure development, raw material support, and marketing facilities are provided to SC/ST artisans in identified artisan villages.Objectives:To identify and revive traditional crafts as sustainable livelihood options.To categorize artisans into skilled, semi-skilled, and unskilled and provide training accordingly.To create awareness, provide orientation training, and develop artisan skills.To promote new technologies and designs and set up raw material depots.To provide marketing support through exhibitions, fairs, and permanent haats.To collect baseline data for planning financial assistance, marketing, and welfare.
Benefits: Free Skill Training:Training is offered at three levels -- awareness & orientation, basic training, and vocational training.Infrastructure Support:Development of artisan villages with electricity, water, roads, and common facilities.Marketing Assistance:Support for exhibitions, fairs, permanent haats, and promotion of Uttarakhand-branded craft products.Raw Material Support:Establishment of raw material depots like Wool Bank, Wood Bank.Recognition & Awards:Awards for outstanding artisans and participation in national/international fairs.Exposure Visits:Exposure tours to other states with advanced handicrafts.
Eligibility: The applicant must be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.The applicant must belong to a Scheduled Caste or Scheduled Tribe community.The applicant's annual income should not exceed Rs1,05,600 in rural areas and Rs1,29,840 in urban areas.
Application_Process: OfflineApplication Process:Step 1: The interested applicant downloads the application form from the official website. Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required).Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the office of the Development Block Office. Selection Process:Step 1: A selection committee chaired by the Chief Development Officer (CDO) selects institutions and trainees.
Documents_Required: Passport-size PhotographVoter IDAadhaar CardDisability Certificate (If applicable)Caste Certificate (If applicable)Any Other Document if Required

Scheme_Name: Scheduled Tribe/Scheduled Caste Sub Plan
Details: The scheme "Scheduled Tribe/Scheduled Caste Sub Plan" was launched by the Department of Fisheries, Government of Uttarakhand. The objective of the scheme is to promote fish production among Scheduled Caste (SC) and Scheduled Tribe (ST) communities by providing financial assistance for the construction of pond clusters in their villages. Under this scheme, a 60% subsidy is provided on first-year investments such as pond construction, fish fingerlings, and feed to individual beneficiaries and groups belonging to the SC/ST categories.
Benefits: Subsidy Amount:For individual SC/ST beneficiaries: Up to Rs3,00,000/- for pond construction of up to 500 cubic meters.For SC/ST Category Committee/Group/ Societies /Federation/Mangal Dal: Up to Rs6,00,000/- for pond construction of up to 1,000 cubic meters.In plain areas, beneficiaries are eligible for a 60% subsidy (amounting to Rs5.10 lakh on the total construction cost of Rs8.50 lakh for a 1-hectare fish pond).Conditions:Minimum 10 ponds should be constructed in one village as a cluster.Ponds of 0.05 to 0.50 hectares can be developed in plain areas.60% of first-year investments (fingerlings and feed) are covered.Technical Assistance:Free technical guidance for high-growth fish species.Optional free training in fishery operations.Mode of Disbursement:Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to beneficiary's bank account. In case of loan, through a bank.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) or Scheduled Tribe (ST) category.The applicant should be residing in either hilly or plain areas.The applicant should be interested in fish production or already engaged in it.The applicant (individual or group) should own land or have leased land with access to a reliable water source.
Application_Process: OfflineOnlineApplication Process:Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the Assistant Director Fisheries/District Fisheries In-Charge at the district level and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required).Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Assistant Director Fisheries/District Fisheries In-charge at the district level.Post-application Process:Step 1: A fisheries inspector/field officer conducts a site survey and prepares a proposal in collaboration with the applicant.Step 2: The proposal is reviewed and approved by the concerned district fisheries officer.Step 3: Pond construction is carried out under the supervision of field personnel. Technical assistance is provided throughout.Step 4: On completion, based on the work completion certificate, the subsidy is released via DBT. In case of loans, subsidy is disbursed through the bank.
Documents_Required: Applicant photographAadhaar CardPermanent Residence CertificateKhasra-Khatauni of Land (Land Ownership Document)Bank Account Details/Copy of Front Page of Bank PassbookMobile NumberGroup Registration Certificate (in case of group application)Land Availability Certificate (if land is not owned by the applicant but is accessible)Photograph of pond construction siteCaste Certificate
Search_Keywords: Scheduled Tribe/Scheduled Caste Sub Plan, stscss, Construction Of Ponds, Financial Assistance, Fish Production, Scheduled Tribe, Scheduled Tribe, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Green Skill Development Programme (GSDP)
Details: The scheme "Harit Kaushal Vikas Karyakram" implemented by the Govind Ballabh Pant National Institute of Himalayan Environment (NIHE), aims to promote sustainable and eco-friendly livelihoods through nature-based skill development. Through this scheme, free skill training is provided to farmers, students, and youth to support self-employment and prepare them for government-backed programs as master trainers. It covers subjects like ornithology, wildlife conservation, natural interpretation, and biodiversity communication. The program is aligned with the Green Skill Development Program (GSDP) and is accessible through online applications via the official portal.
Benefits: Skill Development Training: Free-of-cost training in environment-related fields such as bird identification, wildlife conservation, biodiversity interpretation, and eco-tourism education.Self-Employment Opportunities: Empowers youth and farmers to pursue independent livelihood avenues through knowledge-based interventions.Government Scheme Readiness: Makes candidates eligible for roles under various central/state schemes and government-supported training projects.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a student.The applicant should have completed at least 10th standard.The applicant should be a farmer/ youth or individual seeking self-employment.The applicant should be below 55 years of age at the time of application.The applicant should have an interest in environmental and ecological training topics such as wildlife, biodiversity, or natural resource interpretation.
Application_Process: OfflineStep 1: The applicant can download the prescribed application form or can request it from the Govind Ballabh Pant National Institute of Himalayan Environment (NIHE).Step 2: The applicant must carefully fill out all details in the application form, including personal details, educational qualifications, address, preferred training course, and declaration.Step 3: The applicant should affix a recent passport-size photograph on the form and attach self-attested copies of the required documents.Step 4: The completed application form along with the required documents can be submitted offline in the concerned Institution or through can be send through the following mail ids:gbpihed@envis.nic.inmaheshlyf87@gmail.comdeepudun28@gmail.comContact Us:Public Information OfficerDr. S.C. AryaG.B. Pant National Institute of Himalayan EnvironmentKosi-Katarmal, Almora-263 643, Uttarakhand, India(Code: +91-5962) 241041, 241154 Extn: 70Fax: (05962) 241014, 241150scarya2009@gmail.com
Documents_Required: Filled Application Form.Passport Size Photograph (Recent and affixed on the form).Any other documents as required.

Scheme_Name: Adventure Training for Youth
Details: The "Adventure Training for Youth" scheme was launched by the Department of Youth Welfare and Provincial Protection Corps, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to empower the youth of the state with adventure training skills, disaster preparedness, and confidence-building activities. Under this scheme, free training is provided to the youth in various adventure-based activities such as White Water River Rafting Guide training, disaster management and rescue, Burma Bridge, trekking, and other high-endurance courses.
Benefits: Free Adventure and Disaster Training:The youth of the state are provided free training in various adventure training programmes like White Water River Rafting Guide Training, Disaster Management and Disaster Rescue Operations, First Aid, Burma Bridge, Trekking etc.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.The applicant should be a male or female. The applicant should be between 15 to 30 years of age as on 1st March, 2023.The applicant should have passed at least class 8th.The applicant should be physically fit to undergo adventure training.The applicant should not be suffering from Heart disease, Asthma, Epilepsy, or have rods implanted in arms or legs.The applicant will be given preference if they belong to:A volunteer of Provincial Armed Rural Development (PARD),A member of the National Service Scheme (NSS),A cadet of the National Cadet Corps (NCC),A member/official of Yuvak or Mahila Mangal Dal.
Application_Process: OfflineApplication Process:Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the office of the District Youth Welfare and Provincial Officer (PRD Office) and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required).Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the concerned District Youth Welfare and Provincial Officer (PRD Office).Selection Process:After document verification, candidates are shortlisted and recommended for training by the District Youth Welfare and PRD Officers.Note: The Department invites applications once a year through newspaper advertisements.
Documents_Required: Photocopy of Educational Qualification CertificateTwo Passport Size Color PhotographsAadhaar CardPermanent Residence CertificateMedical Fitness Certificate issued by a Government Medical Officer
Search_Keywords: Adventure Training for Youth, atfy, Adventure Training, River Rafting Training, Trekking, Youth, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Chief Minister State Livestock Mission: Draft Animal Entrepreneurship Development Scheme
Details: The "Draft Animal Entrepreneurship Development Scheme" is a scheme under the Chief Minister State Livestock Mission, introduced by the Department of Animal Husbandry, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote self-employment at the local level by providing interest subsidies on bank loans (for up to three years) for setting up mule units for transport and related activities. Under this scheme, residents of Uttarakhand are eligible for a 90% interest subsidy on loans taken to establish units with one or two mules.
Benefits: The applicant will receive a 90% interest subsidy on the bank loan taken for setting up mule units. The details of financial assistance for establishing one-mule and two-mule units are as follows:Sl. No.Description1 Mule2 Mule1Cost of mule (including insurance premium and transportation)Rs1,00,000/- per muleRs2,00,000/- (Rs1,00,000/- per mule)2Margin Money @ 10% of project costRs10,000/-Rs20,000/-3Bank LoanRs90,000/-Rs1,80,000/-4Estimated Interest Rate (per annum)11%11%5Loan Repayment Period3 Years3 Years
Eligibility: The applicant should be a resident of Uttarakhand.
Application_Process: OfflineTo apply, interested individuals can contact the nearest government veterinary hospital/animal service centers and submit their application in the prescribed format. Note: The applicant should visit the nearest local veterinary hospital along with the consent letter for loan approval from the bank.
Documents_Required: Identity proofProof of residenceConsent Letter for loan approval from the bankBank account detailsAny other documents as required

Scheme_Name: Organisation of Cultural Programs
Details: The scheme "Organisation of Cultural Programs" by the Department of Culture and Endowments, Govt of Uttarakhand, aims to promote regional and national cultural events through listed cultural troupes and artists. Through this scheme, honorarium and travel allowances are provided to cultural troupes/artists for participating in various fairs, festivals, and national events both within and outside the state. The scheme is implemented by the Directorate of Culture, Government of Uttarakhand. Cultural groups are selected through auditions and empanelment based on qualifications and domicile.
Benefits: Group Leader - Honorarium: Rs1,000/-Other Artists Honorarium: Rs800/-Travel Allowance: Rs500/-Other Artists Travel Allowance: Rs400/-A-Grade Folk Singers: Rs7,500/-B-Grade Folk Singers: Rs4,250/-Additional Travel Allowance: Rs300/-Bus Fare (Ordinary Class) and Second-Class Train Fare are reimbursedMode of Disbursement:Direct payment to artists/troupes by the departmentFrequency of Disbursement:Disbursed per event/program participation
Eligibility: The applicant should be a cultural troupe or artist listed in the Culture Department.The applicant should participate in cultural programs organised during fairs, festivals, or national events as approved by the department.The applicant should possess a registration certificate, bio-data, and complete details of the troupe and members.The applicant should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.The applicant should provide a valid Domicile Certificate issued by the Uttarakhand Government.
Application_Process: Offline1. Audition Process:The Directorate of Culture conducts auditions from time to time to enlist cultural troupes and artists in the department's panel.2. Required Documents: To be selected, the interested institution or artist must submit the following:Registration Certificate of the institution (for troupes).Bio-data of the artist or troupe.Details and number of members in the troupe.Permanent Residence Certificate or Domicile Certificate proving that the applicant is a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.3. Listing in the Department:Only those who qualify through the audition and fulfil the documentation requirements are listed as empaneled cultural artists or groups.4. Participation in Events:Once listed, the artists/troupes may be invited by the department to participate in state-level, national, or regional cultural programs, where they receive honorarium and travel reimbursement.
Documents_Required: Registration Certificate (For the cultural troupe/artist)Bio-Data (Of the artist or troupe)Group Members' DetailsDomicile Certificate
