Scheme_Name: Uttarakhand State Andolankari Pension (For Other State)
Details: "Uttarakhand State Andolankari Pension (For Other State)" is a social welfare scheme implemented by the Department of Home, Government of Uttarakhand. Under this scheme, a monthly pension of Rs4,500/- is provided to the injured agitators who were jailed for 7 days from other states during the Uttarakhand State Movement. This pension shall be entitled to those who are not recipients of any Andolankari Pension Schemes/any other government schemes, or not employed in government service.
Benefits: A monthly pension of Rs4,500/-.
Eligibility: The applicant should not be a resident of Uttarakhand.The applicant must have taken part in the Uttarakhand State Movement.The applicant should have either been jailed for at least 7 days or injured during the movement.The applicant should not be a recipient of any Andolankari Pension Schemes/any other government schemes, or not employed in government service.
Application_Process: OfflineStep 1: The applicant needs to submit an application to the office of the District Magistrate (there is no prescribed format for application).Step 2: Attach all the mandatory documents (Self-attested, if required) along with the application form.Step 3: Submit the application at the office of the District Magistrate.
Documents_Required: Application form.Any other documents as required.
Search_Keywords: Uttarakhand State Andolankari Pension (For Other State), usapfos, Agitators, Pension, Social Welfare, Uttarakhand State Movement, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: IT Incubation Center
Details: The scheme "IT Incubation Center" by the Information Technology Development Agency, Government of Uttarakhand aims to nurture and accelerate early-stage startups by providing them with a supportive ecosystem. Through this scheme, startups are provided with mentorship, co-working space, advisory services, and guidance to resolve issues related to business development and innovation. The scheme caters to startups in fields like IT, medical/electronics, health tech, travel-tech, and related sectors. It helps promote entrepreneurship and product innovation, with a focus on enabling entrepreneurs to convert ideas into viable business models.
Benefits: Mentorship & Advisory Support: Guidance on technical, financial, and business development aspects.Domain-Specific Support: Startups in medical/electronics, health tech, travel-tech, and other sectors receive customized mentoring.
Eligibility: The applicant should belong to any of the following categories:Uttarakhand-registered startups.IT students.Medical students.Individuals involved in skill development (especially in IT and Artificial Intelligence).Individuals working in travel and tourism.Individuals engaged in healthcare.Individuals involved in biotechnology.Individuals engaged in robotics.
Application_Process: OfflineStep 1: Interested startups should contact the Startup Team Centre Manager for initial communication.Step 2: Startups must send their requirements via email to: diritda-uk@nic.in.Step 3: The Startup Team will evaluate the startup's needs and initiate the invitation process.Step 4: The Startup Team will request a progress report from the startup company at regular intervals.Step 5: The startup must possess a valid company registration number, a working prototype, and recognized certifications such as ISO.Step 6: The final decision on allocation of incubation space will be made based on availability and a thorough evaluation.
Documents_Required: Company Registration CertificateGovernment-Issued Photo Identity ProofStartup India Recognition Certificate (if available)Brief Startup Proposal (mentioning business model, sector, and innovation)Any other documents as required.
Search_Keywords: IT Incubation Center, itic, Incubation, IT Infrastructure, Startup, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Stipends to Students of Socially and Educationally Backward Classes for Technical and Vocational Courses after SSC
Details: The scheme "Stipends to Students of Socially and Educationally Backward Classes for Technical and Vocational Courses after SSC" by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat aims to promote inclusive education by financially supporting students from Socially and Educationally Backward Classes pursuing technical and vocational education after SSC. The initiative offers a stipend of Rs400/- per month to aid the academic progress and reduce the dropout rate among underprivileged youth. The scheme is implemented by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department. It specifically benefits those enrolled in professional or Government ITI courses and belonging to families with an annual income not exceeding Rs6,00,000/-.
Benefits: Stipend: A monthly stipend of Rs400/- is given to Socially and Educationally Backward Classes students for one year of recognized professional and Government ITI courses.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat.The applicant should belong to Socially and Educationally Backward Classes.The applicant should be a student who has passed the Secondary School Certificate (SSC) examination.The applicant should be enrolled in a recognized professional or Government Industrial Training Institute (ITI) course.The applicant's individual and family income should not exceed Rs6,00,000/- per annum.
Application_Process: OnlineHow to Register:Step 1: Visit the Digital Gujarat portal. Step 2: The user should click on the "Click to register" option. Fill all details and click on "Save".How to Log In:Step 1: Visit the Digital Gujarat portal. Step 2: The user should click on the "Login" option. Step 3: Enter all details and click on "Login".How to Apply for a New Service:Step 1: After logging in, select the relevant department.Step 2: Choose the specific service to apply for within that department.Step 3: Fill out all required details in the application form.Step 4: Upload, attach, or browse necessary documents. Alternatively, import documents directly from DigiLocker.Step 5: Carefully review all entered information.Step 6: Submit the application.Step 7: Once the application is completed, proceed to payment to download the certificate.Step 8: Upon successful payment, the certificate will be available for download.Digital Gujarat (Help Desk)Contact No : 18002335500
Documents_Required: Bank Pass Book/Cancelled Cheque.Caste Certificate.Income Certificate.Other Mark Sheets/Last Year Mark Sheet.Receipet of Fee Paid.

Scheme_Name: Handicraft Mela Participation
Details: The scheme "Handicraft Mela Participation" by the Industrial Extension Cottage (iNDEXT-C), Industries & Mines Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to promote traditional handicrafts by providing artisans and organizations with platforms to showcase and sell their products at state and national-level fairs. The scheme facilitates participation in designated melas (fairs) by covering logistical support and stall allocations. Eligible applicants include individual artisans, self-help groups (SHGs), and registered handicraft organizations. The scheme is implemented by Indext-C (Industrial Extension Bureau, Gujarat), and applications are accepted offline through district offices or the Indext-C portal.
Benefits: Stall Allocation: Free or subsidized stalls at designated melas.Promotional Support: Marketing and branding assistance for participants.Sales Platform: Direct access to customers and bulk buyers.Logistical Aid: Basic infrastructure (tables, signage) provided at mela venues.Financial Incentives: Priority for artisans from SC/ST/SEBC/EWS categories.
Eligibility: For Individual ArtisansThe applicant must be a resident of Gujarat.The applicant must possess a valid Artisan ID Card issued by Indext-C or a recognized authority.The applicant must specialize in a traditional handicraft listed under the scheme (e.g., embroidery, pottery, woodwork).For Organizations/SHGsThe applicant must be a registered cluster/cooperative society/NGO.The applicant must have a minimum of 10 artisans affiliated with the organization.The applicant must submit audit reports and registration certificates.
Application_Process: OfflineStep 1: The interested applicant should take a printout of the prescribed format of the application form from the Indext-C website.Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields ( personal/organization details, artisan ID, and handicraft category, etc), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required).Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form, along with the documents, either to your nearest District Industries Office or to the following address: Indext-C Headquarters, Industrial Extension Cottage, Block No. 7, 1st Floor, Udyog Bhavan, Sector-11, Gandhinagar - 382 011.The Indext-C will review the applications and notify the selected participants via SMS/email.
Documents_Required: Artisan ID Card (for Individuals).Aadhaar Card (Proof of Residence).Caste Certificate (if applying under SC/ST/SEBC/EWS Quota).Organization Registration Proof (for SHGs/Clusters).Bank Account Details (for Disbursements).Recent Passport-Sized Photograph.Handicraft Samples (Photographs or Physical Samples, if requested).Audit Reports (for Organizations).

Scheme_Name: Death Benefit (ANBOCWWB)
Details: The scheme "Death Benefit" was started by the Andaman & Nicobar Islands Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (ANBOCWWB), Department of Labour, Employment & Training, Andaman & Nicobar Administration. Under this scheme, financial assistance shall be provided to the nominees or dependents of workers engaged in Building or Other Construction Works in Andaman & Nicobar Islands in the event of their natural or accidental death.
Benefits: Natural Death:Rs1,00,000/- shall be sanctioned to the nominee or dependent of a registered beneficiary.Accidental Death (During Employment):Rs2,00,000/- may be given to the nominee or dependent of the beneficiary.Accidental Death (Non-registered Construction Workers):Rs50,000/- may be provided, subject to a certificate from the concerned Tehsildar confirming the deceased was a construction worker.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a legal nominee or dependent of the deceased worker.The deceased worker should have been a resident of the Union Territory of Andaman & Nicobar Islands.The deceased worker should have been engaged in any building or other construction work.The financial assistance shall be given to the nominees or dependents of deceased registered workers in the event of their natural or accidental death.The financial assistance shall be given to the nominees or dependents of non-registered construction workers in case of accidental death only.
Application_Process: OnlineOfflinePortal Registration Process:Step 01: Visit online Portal: https://serviceonline.gov.in/login.doStep 02: On the home page, click on 'Register' and fill in all the mandatory details.Step 03: Click on the 'Submit' button and validate your Email ID & Mobile Number using OTP received.Step 04: After successful validation, the applicant will be registered.Application Process for Death Financial Assistance:Step 01: Now, to avail the benefits of the scheme, the applicants can login through their email ID that is used while registeringStep 02: Enter Password & CaptchaStep 03: Click on 'Login'Step 04: After successful login, click on 'Apply for Services' and then 'View all Available Services'Step 05: Now, search for 'Death Financial Assistance' and click on the scheme to proceed to fill out the application form.Step 06: Fill in all the mandatory details and upload all the mandatory documents.Step 07: Preview the application form and click on 'Submit'.Application Tracking:Step 01: To track the application status, the applicant can visit the Online Portal and login through their 'User ID' & 'Password'.Step 02: On the home page, click on "View Application Status' and then click on 'Track Application Status'.Step 03: Enter the Application Reference Number and click on 'Get Data' to know the status of your application.
Documents_Required: Copy of the death certificate.Copy of the nomination/legal heir certificate.Registration ID Card or Identity proof of deceased worker.A certificate from the Tehsildar stating that the deceased was a construction worker, in case of accidental death of a non-registered construction worker.Identity proof of nominee or dependent i.e. Aadhaar Card.Latest Subscription Receipt.Caste certificate, if any.Address proof.Bank Details of Nominee .Any other document as required.
